content:
なかんずく〔就中〕
〈副〉Especially; particularly; first of all; of all things; above all things; before everything; among other things; among the rest

content.content: 彼はなかんずく英語に熟達している
He is especially proficient in English.
なかんずくたいせつな学科は英語と数学だ
The most important branches of all are English and mathematics.
なかんずく好きなのは英語だ
I like English of all things.
なかんずく大事なことはこの誤りに陥らぬことだ
You should, above all,―before everything,―beware of this error.
あまた徳のある中でなかんずく男子に必要な徳は胆力と忍耐である
Among other virtues, those requisite to manhood are grit and perseverance.
男子はなかんずく胆力と忍耐の徳を養うべし
A man should cultivate, among the rest, the virtues of grit and perseverance.

content:
なき〔泣き〕
〈名〉Crying; weeping

content.content: 泣きの涙で別れた
We parted in tears.
泣きを入れる
(哀願するの意味なら)to cry mercy―(売買解約を懇願するの意味なら)―cry off a bargain―bag off a contract

content:
なき〔亡き〕
〈形〉Dead; deceased; departed; the late; gone

content.content: 亡き人
the deceased
亡き父
one's deceased father
亡き夫、亡き妻
one's late lamented
亡き人の数に入る
to join the majority―go over to the majority
亡き人を慕う
to cherish one's memory
亡き夫を慕う
to cherish the memory of one's husband
亡き者にする
to make away with a man
我れ亡き後はこの人に頼れ
When I am gone, you must depend on this man.

content:
なぎ〔凪〕
〈名〉A calm:(=る) to fall calm

content.content: 風が凪ぎる
It falls calm.
風が凪いだ
It has fallen calm.
べた凪に凪いだ
It fell a dead calm.
船が凪に逢う
A ship is becalmed.
今日は実に好い凪だ
The sea is very calm today.
夕凪
an evening calm

なきあかす〔泣き明す〕
〈他動〉(=一夜を泣き明す)to cry (the night) away; to weep through (the night)

content:
なきあと〔亡き後〕
〈副〉After one's death

content.content: 我れ亡き後はこの人に頼れ
When I am gone, you must depend on this man.
亡き後のことを頼む
See that all is well after I am gone!
彼に亡き後の事を頼んだ
I charged him to see to my affairs after my death.
亡き後を弔う
to pray for the repose of one's soul―have masses said for the repose of one's soul

なきあわせ〔鳴き合せ〕
〈名〉A singing-match (between fancy-birds)

なきいる〔泣き入る〕
〈自動〉To have a fit of crying

なきおとこ〔泣き男〕
〈名〉(=葬式の泣き男)A hired mourner; a mute

content:
なきがお〔泣き顔〕
〈名〉A tearful face

content.content: 泣き顔を見せるな
Do not parade your grief!
女は顔をそむけて泣き顔を隠した
She looked away to hide her tears.

content:
なきがら〔亡躯〕
〈名〉One's remains; the corpse; the body

content.content: なきがらを葬る
to consign the body to the grave

なきくずれる〔泣き崩れる〕
〈自動〉To break down

なきくらす〔泣き暮す〕
〈他動〉To cry (the day) away; to pass (one's time) in tears

content:
なきごえ〔泣き声〕
〈名〉A cry; a tearful voice; a whine; a whimper

content.content: あの男はじきに泣き声を出す
He is ready to whine―ready to whimper.
「命ばかりはお助けを」と泣き声で言った
“Spare me!” he whined out―whimpered out.

なきごえ〔鳴き声〕
〈名〉The song, cry, call, note, chirping (of birds); the cawing (of a crow); the cackling, clucking (of a hen); the quacking (of a duck); the neighing, whinnying (of a horse); the lowing, bellowing, mooing (of a cow); the bleating (of a sheep or a calf); the bow-wow (of a dog); the mewing (of a cat); the howling (of a wolf); the roar (of a lion or a tiger); the chirping (of insects); the croaking (of a frog or a raven)

content:
なきごと〔泣き言〕
〈名〉A whine; a whimper; a complaint; a grievance; a tale of woes

content.content: 泣き言を言う
to whine―whimper―complain―grumble
彼は泣き言ばかり言っている
He does nothing but whine―does nothing but complain.
不景気だとかなんだとか泣き言を言っている
He grumbles at the badness of the times and what not.
泣き言を並べる
He airs his grievances.
しかたがないから彼の泣き言を聴いてやった
I had to listen to his tale of woes.
彼は泣き言の手紙を寄越した
He wrote me a complaining letter.

なぎさ〔渚〕
〈名〉A beach; a strand; the water's edge

なきさけぶ〔泣き叫ぶ〕
〈自動〉To howl

なきじゃくり〔泣き吃逆〕
〈名〉A sob; a convulsive sob:(=する) to sob (convulsively)

content:
なきじょうご〔泣き上戸〕
〈名〉A maudlin drinker; a sentimental drunkard

content.content: あの男は泣き上戸だ
He gets maudlin over his cups.

なぎたおす〔薙ぎ倒す〕
〈他動〉To mow down (the enemy's ranks)

content:
なきだす〔泣き出す〕
〈自動〉To fall to crying; to burst into tears; to melt into tears:(こっけいに言えば)to turn on the water-works

content.content: さすがの強情女もわっと泣き出した
Obstinate woman as she was, she burst into a flood of tears.
説教に感じて聴衆が泣き出した
The sermon was so touching that the congregation melted into tears.
悲報に接して家族が泣き出した
The family fell to crying at the sad news―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sad news set the family (to) crying.
女は今にも泣き出しそうだった
She was ready to cry.
それを思うと泣き出したくなる
I feel like crying―I feel wretched―when I think of it.
手術を受けて泣き出すような日本人は無い
No Japanese would howl under the hands of a surgeon.

なぎたてる〔薙ぎ立てる〕
〈自動〉To lay about one

なきたま〔亡き魂〕
〈名〉A departed soul

content:
なきつく〔泣き付く〕
〈他動〉To entreat (one) with tears; to implore (one) for help

content.content: 領事に泣きついて旅費を貸して貰った
I got the consul to provide me with travelling expenses.
泣きついて来たからゆるしてやった
I forgave the penitent.

content:
なきつぶす〔泣き潰す〕
〈他動〉(=目を泣き潰す)To cry oneself blind; to cry one's eyes out

content.content: あまりの悲しさに目を泣きつぶした
She cried herself blind in her sorrow.
今時の女で男のために泣きつぶすような者は無い
No girl nowadays would cry her eyes out over a lover.

なきつぶれる〔泣き潰れる〕
〈自動〉To break down

content:
なきつら〔泣き面〕
〈名〉A tearful face; a tear-stained face

content.content: 泣き面に蜂
“Out of the frying-pan into the fire”―“Misfortunes never come singly.”
泣き面に蜂で病人までもできた
To make matters worse, one of us fell ill.

content:
なきどころ〔泣き所〕
〈名〉A weak point; a vulnerable point

content.content: 弁慶の泣き所
Achilles's heels―a vulnerable point.

content:
なきなき〔泣き泣き〕
〈副〉With tears in one's eyes; with reluctance

content.content: 泣き泣きその品を手放した
I parted with the article with great reluctance.
泣き泣きその金を払った
I paid the money under protest.
泣き泣き国へ帰った
I went home with a heavy heart.

なぎなた〔長刀〕
〈名〉A kind of halberd

content:
なきねいり〔泣き寝入り〕
〈名〉
1. (=に寝る)(=泣きながら寝入る)to cry oneself to sleep

content.content: 子どもは泣き寝入りに寝てしまった
The child has cried itself to sleep.

content: 2. (=にする)(=黙って忍ぶ)to let the matter drop; to let the matter rest there; to pocket an insult; to swallow an insult

content.content: 相手が相手だから泣き寝入りにするよりほかは無い
Knowing whom we have to deal with, we must let the matter drop.
あの事件はとうとう泣き寝入りさ
We ended by letting the affair rest there.
取りつく島も無く泣き寝入った
I was thrown upon my own resources, and dropped the matter.
相手が名代の代物だからどんな無理を言われても泣き寝入りにするよりほかは無い
As we have to deal with a notorious scoundrel, I must pocket the insult as best I may.

content:
なきのなみだで〔泣きの涙で〕
〈副〉In tears; with tears in one's eyes

content.content: 泣きの涙で別れた
We parted in tears.
彼女は泣きの涙で物語った
She told her story with tears in her eyes.

content:
なきはらす〔泣き腫らす〕
〈他動〉(=目を泣き腫らす)To blubber (one's face); to swell (the eyes) with crying

content.content: 女は目を泣きはらしておった
She was blubbered with crying―Her eyes were swollen with crying―swollen and red with crying―blubbered with crying.

content:
なきひと〔亡き人〕
〈名〉The deceased(は単数); the dead(は複数)

content.content: 亡き人の数に入る
to join the majority―go over to the majority
亡き人を慕う
to cherish one's memory

content:
なきふす〔泣き伏す〕
〈自動〉To break down; to abandon oneself to grief

content.content: 死んだと聞いて彼女はよよとばかりに泣き伏した
On hearing of his death, she broke down and abandoned herself to grief.

なきまね〔泣き真似〕
〈名〉Sham tears; false tears; crocodile tears:(=する) to cry sham tears; to cry false tears; to cry crocodile tears

content:
なきまろぶ〔泣き転ぶ〕
〈自動〉To abandon oneself to grief

content.content: 人目無ければ前後不覚に泣きまろぶ
Left to herself, she abandoned herself to a paroxysm of grief.

content:
なきむし〔泣き虫〕
〈名〉A cry-baby

content.content: この子は泣き虫で困る
The child is given to crying.

content:
なきもの〔亡き者〕
〈名〉The deceased(は単数); the dead(は複数)

content.content: 人を亡き者にする
to make away with a man

なきやむ〔泣き止む〕
〈自動〉To stop crying; to cry oneself out

なきわかれ〔泣き別れ〕
〈名〉Parting in tears:(=する) to part in tears; to cry at parting

なきわらい〔泣き笑い〕
〈名〉Smiling through one's tears:(=する) to smile through one's tears

content:
なく〔泣く〕
〈自動〉
1. To cry:(涙を流して泣く)to weep; to shed tears:(しゃくり上げて泣く)to sob:(わいわい泣く)to howl:(べそをかいて泣く)to blubber:(悲しんで泣く)to wail:(男泣きに泣く)to be overcome; to be unmanned:(我慢しきれずに泣く)to give way to one's feelings:(こっけいに言えば)to pipe one's eye; to turn on the water-works

content.content: お前泣いたね
You have been crying.
泣くな
Stop crying!
子どもじゃあるまいし泣くな
Be a man, and don't cry!
いくら悲しくともそう泣くな
Don't give way to your feelings!―Don't take on so!
(痛くとも)泣かずに我慢しろ
Grin and bear it!
何で泣いているか
Why are you crying?―What are you crying for?
うちへ帰ってみると家族は泣いておった
I found my family in tears.
一家は悲報に接して泣いておった
The family were crying at the sad news.
僕は嬉し泣きに泣いた
I cried for joy―wept for joy.
貰い泣きして泣いた
I cried for company.
悔しくて泣きたかった
I could have cried for vexation.
子どもが痛がって泣く、痛がってわいわい泣く
The child cries with pain.
子は飢えに泣く
My child cries with hunger.
子どもは乳が欲しくて泣く
The child cries for milk.
女は夫の死骸に取りすがって泣いておった
She was crying over his remains.
墓前に泣いた
I have cried over his grave.
人の死を悲んで泣く
to cry over one's death―bewail one's death
武士は我が子が死んでも泣かぬ
The Samurai does not cry over the death of his son.
あの子は小説を読んで泣いている
She will cry over a novel.
芝居を見て泣くのは男らしくないか
Is it unmanly to cry over a play?
泣かざるを得ぬ
I can not (choose) but cry―can not help crying―can not refrain from tears.
誰か泣かざるを得ん
Who can choose but cry?―Who can help crying?―Who can do otherwise than cry?
これを読んで泣かざるを得ぬ
I can not read this without crying.
これを読んで誰か泣かざるを得ん
Who can read this without crying?―Who can read this with dry eyer?
これが泣かずに読めるか
Can you read this without crying?―with dry eyes?
これを読みて泣かざる者は人にあらず
He who can read this with dry eyes is not a man.
聴衆に泣かない者は一人も無かった
There was not a dry eye in the audience.
人前を憚って泣かずにおった
I refrained from tears from a sense of decency.
それを思うと泣きたいような気がする
I feel like crying―feel inclined to cry―feel wretched―when I think of it.
泣きたいのをこらえる
gulp down one's tears
女は泣いてばかりいる
She does nothing but cry.
泣いたってしようがない
It is no use crying―Crying will not help matters―Crying will not mend matters.
泣きたいだけ泣いた、存分泣いた、心行くばかり泣いた
I cried to my heart's content―cried my fill―had my cry out―had a good cry.
あまり悲しくてかえって泣けぬ、泣けないほど悲しい
My sorrow is too deep for tears.
泣いても足らぬ
I can not cry enough.
泣くに泣かれず実に困った
I repressed my tears in impotent rage.
彼女は泣いて頼んだ
She begged with tears in her eyes.
女は胸が張り裂けそうに泣いた
She cried as if her heart would break―cried her heart out.
ひそひそと泣いた、潜然と泣いた
She cried bitterly―wept copiously.
しくしく泣いておった
She was weeping in secret―sobbing in secret.
赤児がおぎゃーと泣く
A baby mewls―howls.
子どもが昨夜泣きづめに泣いた
The child kept crying last night.
女の身の上話を聞いて男泣きに泣いた
I was overcome by her story―unmanned by her story.
僕はこの唄を聞くと泣く
The song overcomes me―unmans me.
鬼神も為に泣く
Even the very gods themselves cry over it―It is sublime.
鬼神を泣かしむ
to shake the spheres
泣いて暮らすも一生笑って暮らすも一生
Lead a merry life.
泣いても笑っても無い物は無い
It is not to be had for love or money.
泣いても笑ってもこれきり
These are all to be had for love or money.
泣いても笑っても一週間経てば試験だ
The examination is bound to come in a week's time.
泣く子をだます
to hush a crying child―still a crying child
その名を聞けば泣く子も黙る
The nurse stills the child with the terrors of his name.
泣く子と地頭には勝たれぬ
The crying child and my lord will have their way.
泣く子に乳だ
That is the very thing―just the thing.
女が男を泣かせる
A girl breaks a man's heart.
この子は今にお母さんを泣かせるぞ
He will break his mother's heart.
この子には泣かされました
He has broken my heart―I have broken my heart over him.
そんな絵を画かれては金屏風が泣く
The gold-screen is spoilt by the daub.
そんな読みようをするとシェークスピアが泣くぞ、シェークスピアを地下に泣かしむるなかれ
You will make Shakespeare turn in his grave―Shade of Shakespeare!
そんな英語を使うと Johnson が泣く
You will make Johnson gape and stare―Shade of Johnson.

content:
なく〔鳴く〕
〈自動〉(Animals and birds) cry, call; (birds) sing, chirp, twitter, warble, carol; (crows) caw; (sparrows) chirp; (cocks) crow; (hens) cackle, cluck; (ducks) quack; (chickens) peep, cheep; (doves) coo; (owls) hoot, screech; (turkeys) gobble; (uguisu) warble; (night-herons) boom; (dogs) yelp, whine; (cats) mew; (horses) neigh, whinny; (asses) bray; (cows) low, moo, bellow; (sheep) bleat, baa; (pigs) grunt, squeal; (rats and mice) squeak; (lions and tigers) roar; (wolves) howl; (bears) growl; (elephants) trumpet; (insects) chirp; (cicadas) sing; (frogs and ravens) croak

content.content: 雨蛙が鳴くのは雨の前兆
When a tree-frog creaks, it is a sign of rain.
あれ鶏が鳴く
Hark! The cock crows.
三年飛ばず鳴かず
I lie fallow for three years.
烏の鳴かぬ日はあっても二人の逢わぬ日は無い
Not a day passes without their meeting.

content:
なぐ〔凪ぐ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: なぎ〔凪〕

content:
なぐ〔薙ぐ〕
〈他動〉To mow; to cut down

content.content: 草をなぐ
to mow the grass―cut down the grass
彼は長刀をふるって寄せ来る敵をなぎ倒した
Brandishing his halberd, he mowed the enemy's ranks―swept the enemy.
なぎ立てる
to lay about one

content:
なくこ〔泣く子〕
〈名〉A crying child

content.content: 泣く子をだます
to hush a crying child―still a crying child
泣く子と地頭には勝たれぬ
The crying child and my lord will have their way.
その名を聞けば泣く子も黙る
The nurse stills the child with the terrors of his name.
泣く子に乳だ
That is the very thing―just the thing.

content:
なぐさみ〔慰み〕
〈名〉
1. (=娯楽)amusement; pastime; fun; sport

content.content: 雨降りにはどんな慰みがあるかね
What is your amusement in rainy weather?―How do you amuse yourself in wet weather?
僕の慰みは読書だ
I amuse myself (by) reading.
あの人の慰みは音楽だ
He amuses himself with music.
僕は慰みに本を読むのじゃない
I do not read for pleasure.
お慰みに運勢を見て上げよう
I will tell fortunes for your amusement.
慰みに舞踊をやってみた
I tried dancing for fun―out of fun―in sport―out of sport.
あの西洋人は慰み半分に日本語をやっている
He is learning Japanese for the fun of the thing.
彼は一時の慰みにその女と関係したのだ
He intrigued with the girl for the amusement of the hour―to beguile an idle hour.
釣りは好い慰みだ
Angling is a good pastime.
僕の好きな慰みは銃猟だ
Shooting is my favourite pastime.
あの人の学問は慰み学問だ
He is an amateur student―a dilettante.

content: 2. (=気晴し)diversion; recreation; distraction; relaxation

content.content: 僕は勉強に飽きた時慰みに音楽をやる
When I am tired of study, I practise music by way of diversion―I take to music as a recreation.

content: 3. (=手慰み)gambling

content.content: 慰みをやる
to gamble

content:
なぐさみもの〔慰み物〕
〈名〉A plaything

content.content: 女を慰み物にする
to make a plaything of a girl
女は男の慰み物になる
A girl is made a man's plaything.
一時の慰み物にされるのはいやだ
I do not like to be made a temporary plaything―I would not serve a man's pleasure of the moment.

content:
なぐさむ〔慰む〕
〈自動〉(=楽む)to amuse oneself; to divert oneself

content.content: 雨降りにはどうして慰むか
How do you amuse yourself in rainy weather?
本を読んで慰む
I amuse myself (by) reading.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=なだめる)to appease

content.content: 亡魂を慰む
to appease one's spirit
忠魂を慰む
to appease the spirits of the brave defenders of the land
無聊を慰む
to beguile the tedium―beguile the time―while away the time―kill time

content: 2. (=弄ぶ)to play with, sport with (a person)

content.content: 田舎者を一つ慰んでやろうじゃないか
Let us have some sport with our rustic!

content: 3. (=強姦する)to rape, outrage, violate, ravish, seduce (a woman)

なぐさめ〔慰め〕
〈名〉Comfort; consolation; solace:(=る) to comfort (one in one's sorrow); to console (one for a loss); to solace (one's heart); to cheer (an invalid); to gladden, make glad (one's heart); to appease (the gods)

content.content: 子どもは慰めになる
One's children are a comfort.
タバコ草は戦地で慰めになる
Tobacco is a consolation at the front.
彼は宗教によって慰めを得ている
He finds solace in religion―solaces himself with religion.
音楽に慰めを求める
He seeks for solace in music.
子どもを無くしても人の子どもを教育すれば慰めになる
To educate others' children will console me for the loss of my own.
彼は僕の悲みを慰めてくれた
He comforted me in my sorrow―consoled me in my grief―found me sad and left me happy.
心を慰める
to take comfort in anything
僕は読書をもって心を慰める
I take comfort in reading.
老人は孫どもで大いに心を慰めている
The old man takes a great deal of comfort in his grandchildren.
こうやって働くのが国家の為になるのだと思えば自ら慰めることができる
I can comfort myself―console myself―with the thought that I am working for the good of my country.
彼女が子どもを無くしたのを慰めておやりなさい
You must comfort her for the loss of her child―console her in her affliction.
病人を慰めてやれ
You must cheer up the invalid.
酒は心を慰む
“Wine maketh the heart glad.”
目を慰める
to gladden one's eyes―feast one's on wonders
叡慮{えいりょ}を慰め奉れ
Make glad the Emperor's heart!
亡霊を慰める
to appease one's spirit

content:
なくす〔無くす〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: なくなす〔無くなす〕

content:
なくて〔無くて〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=無ければ、無くとも)without

content.content: 当分はこの金が無くてすむ
I can do without this money for the present.
金が無くては何もできぬ
Without money, one can do nothing.
忍耐が無くては成功することができぬ
One can not succeed without perseverance.
奇蹟でも無くては彼は助かるのではなかった
Nothing short of a miracle could have saved him.

content: 2. (=無い為に)from want of(は原因): for want of(は理由): for

content.content: 金が無くて行かれない
I can not go for want of money―for lack of money.
雨が無くて作物が弱っている
The crops are suffering from want of rain―from lack of rain.
金が無くて困っている
I am pressed for money.
時が無くて困っている
I am pressed for time.
無くて困る物がたくさんある
I want for many things.

content:
なくてならぬ〔無くてならぬ〕
〈形〉Necessary (to one―for some purpose); essential (to happiness); indispensable (to success); not to be done without; not to be dispensed with; not to be spared

content.content: 睡眠は健康の為に無くてはならぬものだ
Sleep is necessary to health.
健康は幸福の為に無くてはならぬものだ
Health is essential to happiness.
彼は学校に無くてはならぬ人だ
He is necessary to the school―The school can not spare that man.
辞書は学生には無くてはならぬものだ
A dictionary is indispensable to a student―A student can not do without a dictionary.
あれは役所に無くてならない人だ
He is indispensable to the office―His services are not to be dispensed with.
米は日本人に無くてならぬ食料だ
Rice is an indispensable article of food to the Japanese―The Japanese can not do without rice.
この金はぜひ無くてならぬ
I need the money badly.
無くてならぬ物(衣食住の必需品)
the necessaries of life

content:
なくなく〔泣く泣く〕
〈副〉With tears in one's eyes; with sorrow

content.content: 泣く泣く故郷を離れた
I left my beloved home with sorrow―I tore myself from my beloved home.
泣く泣く葬式をすました
We buried him with an aching heart.
彼女は泣く泣く一人娘を手放した
She parted with her only daughter in bitterness of heart.

content:
なくなす〔無くなす〕
〈他動〉To lose; to be deprived of (anything); to be bereaved of (a child); to be shorn of (capital); to be fleeced of (one's possessions)

content.content: 財布を無くした
I have lost my purse.
彼は不幸に逢って身代を無くなした
He has lost his fortune through misfortune―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Misfortune has deprived him of his fortune.
彼は子どもを皆無くなした
He is bereaved of all his children.
彼は子どもを無くして諦めかねている
He can not get over the loss of his children.
彼は資本を無くなして帰って来た
He returned shorn of his capital.
彼は足を一本無くなして戦争から帰って来た
He returned from the war without one leg―minus one leg.

content:
なくなる〔無くなる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=無い様になる)there will be none

content.content: 今に英語を知らない者は無くなる
There will soon be no people who do not know English.

content: 2. (=失われる)to be lost; to be gone; to be missing

content.content: 僕の財布が無くなった
My purse is gone―My purse is missing―I can not find my purse.
今ここにあった物が無くなるはずが無い
What was here now, can not have been lost.

content: 3. (=切れる)to run out; to run short; to run low; to be out; to be up; to go

content.content: 金が無くなる
Money is running out―running short―running low.
その金がどうして無くなったかわからぬ
How the money went, I hardly know.
もう金が無くなった
My money is out.
タバコが無くなる
My tobacco is out.
時間が無くなる
Time is up.

content: 4. (=切らす、尽きる)to run out of (cash); to come to the end of (one's money)

content.content: 小遣いが無くなった
I have run out of my pocket-money―I am out of my pocket-money.
資本が無くなった
I have come to the end of my capital―I am at the end of my capital.

content: 5. (=消える)to disappear; to vanish from sight; to go out of sight

content.content: 消えて無くなれ
Out of my sight, sirrah!

content: 6. (=亡くなる)to die

content.content: 彼が亡くなってからもう三年になる
It is three years since he died.
俺がなくなったら後の事を頼む
When I am gone, see that all is well.
父は亡くなりました
My father is no more.

content: 7. (=何々しなくなる)to cease to (do something)

content.content: 何でも珍しくなくなると人は驚かなくなる
When anything ceases to be novel, people will cease to wonder.
あの人はどもらなくなった
He has ceased to stammer.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 宗教を信ずると死ぬのが怖くなくなる
Religion deprives death of its terrors.
ボロを隠そうとしなけりゃ貧乏も辛くなくなる
Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sting.

content:
なくもがな〔無くもがな〕
〈祈願法〉May there be none!

content.content: 宴会の長演説は無くもがなだ
Long speeches at a banquet may as well be done without.
今になってみるとあの時の心配は無くもがなであった
Now that I come to think of it, we might have been spared that anxiety at that time.

content:
なぐりあい〔殴り合い〕
〈名〉Fighting with the fists; fisticuffs:(=する) to fight with the fists; to engage in fisticuffs; to exchange blows

content.content: 殴り合いを始める
to fall to blows―come to blows
口論から殴り合いになった
From words, they came to blows―They proceeded from words to blows.
二人は殴り合いをしておった
They were at cuffs with each other.

content:
なぐりがき〔殴り書き〕
〈名〉A scribble; a scrawl:(=する) to scribble; to scrawl

content.content: 手紙を殴り書きする
to dash off a letter

content:
なぐりつける〔殴り付ける〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: なぐる〔殴る〕

content:
なぐる〔殴る〕
〈他動〉
1. To thrash; to lick; to drub; to pommel; to strike; to beat

content.content: 一つ殴ってやれ、そうすれば奴も目が覚める
Give him a thrashing, and that will bring him to his senses.
うんと殴ってやった
I gave him a sound thrashing―gave him a good licking―gave him a good drubbing.
彼がそんなことをしあがったら殴ってやる
If he does such a thing, I'll give it him―I'll dust his coat for him.
めちゃめちゃに殴ってやった
I pommelled him―beat him to a jelly―knocked him into a cocked hat.
早速殴ってやった
I finished him on the spot.
頭を殴ってやった
I struck him on the head―struck him over the head.
頭をいやというほど殴ってやった
I gave him a hard blow on the head.
彼は僕を殴りかねない権幕だった
He looked as if he could have struck me.
殴るなら殴ってみろ
I dare you to strike me.
殴ってしまえ(野次馬口調で言えば)
Down with him!
殴られる
to get thrashed―get a thrashing―get licked―get a licking
彼は牛殺しに殴られた
He was thrashed within an inch of his life.
頭を殴られる
to receive a blow on the head―(こっけいに言えば)―stop a blow with one's head
貴様は(そんなことを言って)殴られたいのか
Do you want a thrashing?
貴様はいつも殴られたがっている
You are always throwing yourself in the way of getting thrashed.
人を殴り殺す
to strike one dead
殴り倒す
to knock one down
殴り殴り覚えさせる
to beat an idea into one's head
殴って思い切らせる
to beat a notion out of one's head
殴って勉強させる
to beat one into industry
殴って止めさせる
to beat one out of a habit
子どもを殴り殴り人間らしくする
to lick a boy into shape

content: 2. (=仕事を粗末にする)to slight, fudge, scamp (one's work)

なげ〔投げ〕
〈名〉
1. (=相撲の投げ)a fall; a throw
2. (=投げ売り)a sacrifice sale

content:
なげうつ〔抛つ〕
〈他動〉To give up, abandon (an attempt); to renounce, disclaim, waive (a right); to relinquish, resign, forego (a claim); to resign, deliver up (one's possessions); to throw up, fling up (one's office); to throw away (an opportunity); to lay down, give, lose, sacrifice (one's life); to lay aside (some work)

content.content: 彼は万事をなげうって専らこの仕事にかかった
He gave up everything to devote himself to the work.
地位をなげうつ
to throw up one's office―fling up one's situation
職をなげうつこと弊履を捨つるが如し
He threw up his office as if he were throwing away an old hat.
権利をなげうつ
to renounce one's rights―disclaim one's rights―waive one's rights―relinquish one's claim―resign one's claim―forego one's claim
財産をなげうつ
to resign one's property―deliver up one's property
生命をなげうつ
to lay down one's life―give one's life―lose one's life―sacrifice one's life
国家のために身命をなげうった人々だ
They laid down their lives for their country―gave their lives for their country.
彼は一命をなげうって人を助けた
He saved others―(死んでなら)―at the price of his life―at the cost of his life―at the sacrifice of his life―(死ぬ覚悟でなら)―at the risk of his life―at the hazard of his life―at the peril of his life.
発明者がこの発明のために一命をなげうった
The inventor lost his life in making this invention―The invention cost the inventor his life.
事業は一年間なげうってある
The work has been laid aside for a year.

content:
なげうり〔投げ売り〕
〈名〉A sacrifice sale; a slaughter sale:(外国市場への投げ売り)dumping:(=する) to sell (goods) at a sacrifice; to sell (anything) for an old song; to sell (anything) dirt-cheap; to dump (goods at a foreign market)

content.content: 田舎へ引込む時東京の家を投げ売りにして行った
When we retired into the country, the town-house was sold for a mere song.
不景気のために織元で品物を投げ売りにしている
Owing to commercial depression, the weavers are sacrificing their goods.
商人が本国の相場を保つために品物を外国の市場へ投げ売りすることがある
Merchants sometimes dump their goods at a foreign market to avoid lowering home price.

content:
なげかわしい〔歎かわしい〕
〈形〉Lamentable (death); regrettable (circumstance); mournful (event); sorrowful (occurrence); deplorable (state of things, etc.)

content.content: この場合に彼が死んだのは実に歎かわしいことだ
His death at this moment is deeply to be lamented.
あんな者を威張らしておくのは歎かわしいことだ
It is deplorable that such men should hold up their heads.
日本に鉄山の無いのは歎かわしいことだ
That Japan should be wanting in iron mines, is a matter for regret.
家庭が歎かわしいほど乱れている
The household is deplorably disordered.

content:
なげき〔歎き〕
〈名〉Grief; sorrow; lamentation

content.content: あの時死んでしまったならこうした歎きはあるまいものを
If I had died then, I might have been spared this grief.
これを聞いた時の彼女の歎きは一通りでなかった
Her grief at this news was excessive.
一家は歎きに沈んでいる
The family is plunged in grief.
歎きの数を尽した
I have drained the cup of sorrow to the dregs.
親に歎きをかけるのだけが残念だ
My only regret is to grieve my parents.
彼が死んだ時の家族の歎きは見るに忍びなかった
I could not bear to see his family lament his death.

content:
なげく〔歎く〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=歎息する)to sigh; to heave a sigh
2. (=悲歎する)to grieve, be grieved (at sad news―over a sad event―for a person); to sorrow (at sad news―over a sad event―for a person); to lament (one's departure); to cry over, weep over, mourn over (one's death); to bewail, bemoan (one's death); to deplore (the state of things, etc.)

content.content: 女が夫の死を歎いている
She laments his death―grieves over his death―sorrows over his death―mourns over his death―cries over his death.
討死と聞かばさこそ歎かん可哀いやな
She will grieve, poor soul! at the news of my death.
身の不幸を歎く
to bewail one's misfortune―repine at misfortune―curse the day of one's birth
彼は家庭の乱脈を歎いている
He deplores the disordered condition of the household.

content:
なげくび〔投げ首〕
〈名〉A bowed head

content.content: 思案投げ首
He has his head bowed in meditation.

content:
なげこむ〔投げ込む〕
〈他動〉To throw in; to fling in

content.content: 手紙を火の中へ投げ込んだ
I threw the letter into the fire.
水夫が船長を海へ投げ込んだ
The sailors threw the captain overboard.
賽銭箱へ賽銭を投げ込む
to throw a coin into the offertory-box

なげし〔長押〕
〈名〉A horizontal timber round the walls of a room (about six feet from the floor); a sort of architrave (just above the lintel of the sliding doors)

content:
なげすてる〔投げ棄てる〕
〈他動〉To throw away; to cast away; to give up; to abandon

content.content: 積荷を投げ棄てる
to jettison the cargo

なげそうば〔投げ相場〕
〈名〉A sacrifice price

content:
なげだす〔投げ出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=抛り出す)to throw out; to fling out; to fling away; to fling aside

content.content: 足を投げ出す
to throw out one's legs
身体を投げ出して坐る
to fling oneself down (on the floor)
彼は本を投げ出して遊びに行った
He flung aside his book, and went out to play.
持っていた鉄砲を投げ出して逃げた
He flung away his gun, and fled.
馬車から投げ出された
I was shot out of the coach―spilt from the coach.

content: 2. (=放棄する)to give up, abandon (one's work); to renounce (a right); to relinquish (a claim); to deliver up, resign (one's possessions); to throw up, fling up (one's office); to sacrifice lay down (one's life)

content.content: 地位を投げ出す
to throw up one's office―fling up one's situation
十万石投げ出した
I throw up my fief―I take the responsibility on myself.
(勝利を断念して)札を投げ出す
to throw up one's cards
財産を投げ出す
to deliver up one's property (to one's creditors)
命を投げ出す
to lay down one's life―sacrifice one's life
彼は命を投げ出して人を助けた
He saved others at the risk of his life―at the price of his life.
命を投げ出してかかる
to carry one's life in one's hands―take one's life in one's hands
命を投げ出してかかればどんなことでもできないことは無い
Nothing is impossible to the man who does not fear death.
一身を投げ出した仕事だ
I sacrificed myself to the work.
株を投げ出す
to spill one's stocks
鉄砲を投げ出して降参する
to lay down one's arms

content:
なげつける〔投げ付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=ぶっつける)to throw, fling, hurl, shy (anything at a person)

content.content: 犬に石を投げつける
to throw a stone at a dog
人に石を投げつける
to throw stones at a man―pelt a man with stones

content: 2. (=投げ倒す)to fling

content.content: 相撲が相手を投げつける
A wrestler flings his adversary―gives his antagonist a fall.

content:
なけなし〔無けなし〕
〈形〉The little (money) one has; what little (money) one has

content.content: 無けなしの金を出したのだ
I gave what little money I had―what money I had.

なげに〔投げ荷〕
〈名〉Jetsam; jettisoned cargo:(=する) to jettison cargo

content:
なげやり〔投げ遣り〕
〈名〉Neglect; negligence:(=にする) to neglect (one's work); to let (anything) alone; to leave (anything) alone

content.content: 職務を投げやりにする
to neglect one's duties
仕事は投げやりになっている
The work has fallen into neglect.
子どもは投げやりにしておく
I let my children alone―leave my children alone.

content:
なげやり〔投槍〕
〈名〉A javelin; a dart

content.content: 投槍を投げる
to hurl a dart at the enemy

content:
なげる〔投げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To throw (a stone); to cast (a treasure); to hurl (a lance); to fling (one's antagonist); to pitch (a ball); to shy (a stone)

content.content: 石を投げる
to throw a stone―shy a stone
石を投げるな
Do not throw stones!
石を投げれば届くくらいの所にある
It is only a stone's throw from here.
投げてやる
to throw a bone to a dog―throw a coin to a beggar
球を投げる
to throw a ball―pitch a ball―deliver a ball
相撲が相手を投げる
A wrestler flings his adversary―gives his adversary a fall.
相手を担いで投げる
to fling one's antagonist off one's shoulder
身を投げる
to throw oneself into a river―drown oneself―(船からなら)―throw oneself overboard

content: 2. (=抛棄する)to abandon, give up (a project); to throw up (one's cards); to throw away (an opportunity); to give over (a patient); to jettison (cargo)

content.content: (勝利を断念して)札を投げる
to throw up one's cards
勝負を投げる
to give up a game―throw up the sponge
医者が匙を投げる
A doctor gives up a case―gives over a patient.
彼の病気は医者も匙を投げた
He was given over by his doctor.
もう試験を投げた
I have thrown up the examination.
始めから投げてかかった
I went at it without any hope of success.
積荷を投げる
to jettison the cargo

なげわ〔投げ環〕
〈名〉(The game of) throwing hoops

なげわな〔投げ罠〕
〈名〉A lasso

content:
なこうど〔仲人〕
〈名〉(事)match-making; (whose) good offices:(人)a match-maker; a go-between; Hymen

content.content: 仲人をする
to go between the parties―make a match―arrange a marriage―use one's good offices
仲人役を勤める
to act as go-between―play the Hymen
俺が仲人をしよう
I will act as go-between.
あの人は仲人好きだ
He is a match-maker.
この縁談は誰の仲人でまとまったか
Who made the match?―Who went between the parties?―Through whose good offices was the marriage arranged?
仲人の嘘八百、仲人口は当てにならぬ
The match-maker's story must be taken with a grain of salt.
仲人は草鞋{わらじ}千足
The match-maker has a busy time of it between the two parties.
仲人は宵の内
The go-between's duties end with the ceremony.

content:
なごり〔名残り〕
〈名〉
1. (=別離)parting; departure

content.content: これがこの世の名残りとなるかも知れぬ
This may be our last parting.
あれがこの世の名残りであった
I saw her then for the last time.
彼はこの世の名残りに豪遊を極めた
He indulged in riotous pleasures as a farewell to life.
この世の名残りにいま一度会いたい
Would that I could see him once more before I die!
お名残りにいっしょに写真を取ろう
Let us have ourselves photographed together before parting.
名残りの涙
tears at parting
名残りの盃
a parting cup―a stirrup-cup
名残り狂言
a farewell performance
名残りを惜しむ
to regret one's departure―to be sorry to part
君が去るのは名残りが惜しい
I am sorry to part from you―I am sorry you are leaving―I regret your departure―I shall feel your loss―I shall miss you very much.
互いに名残りを惜しんで別れた
We parted with mutual regret―(と言うよりも普通は)―We parted with many expressions of good-will and esteem―We parted on the best of terms―We parted the best of friends.
彼に別れを告げた時はまことに名残りが惜しかった
When I bade him farewell, I really―(自分が去るのなら)―regretted his departure―(人が去るのなら)―regretted his departure
これが故郷の見納めかと思うと名残りを惜しまざるを得なかった
As I took a last view of my beloved home, I could not bet feel a pang of separation.

content: 《b》(=別離の悲しみ)sorrow at parting

content.content: いつまで話しても名残りは尽きぬ
You may talk all night, and yet you will be as sorry to part as ever.
尽きぬ名残りを惜しむ
to have endless sorrow at parting

content: 2. (=残跡)remains; traces; relics; souvenirs

content.content: 彼女はまだ艶麗なりし昔の名残をとどめている
She still retains the traces of her former charms.
館には昔日の栄華の名残りがある
The mansion contains some relics of its former splendour.
千代田城は昔の名残りに満ちている
The Chiyoda castle is instinct with souvenirs of the past.
これらの習慣は野蛮時代の名残りだ
These customs are the remains of the barbarous ages.
春の花がまだ野に名残りをとどめている
The flowers of spring still linger in the field.
市区改正で昔の名残りが無くなる
Owing to the improvements, the city is losing its wonted look―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The improvements will deprive the city of its wonted look.
永らく降り続いた雨も名残り無く晴れた
The long rain has given place to a clear sky.

なごり〔余波〕
〈名〉The sea left by a gale

content:
なごりおしい〔名残り惜しい〕
〈形〉(To be) sorry to part

content.content: 明日はお立ちかお名残り惜しや
Are you leaving tomorrow? I am sorry you are going―I am sorry to part from you―I regret your departure.
彼に別れを告げた時はまことに名残り惜しかった
When I bade him farewell, I really―(自分が去るなら)―regretted my departure―(人が去るのなら)―regretted his departure.
彼は去るのが名残り惜しそうに見えた
He seemed to regret his departure.
彼が去るので皆名残り惜しそうに見えた
They seemed to regret his departure.
二人は名残り惜しそうに別れた
They parted with mutual regret―parted with regretful looks.
これが故郷の見納めかと思うとなんとなく名残り惜しかった
As I took a last view of my beloved home, I could not but feel a pang of separation.
(愛する人に死なれて)実に名残り惜しいことをした
I can not get over her loss―I miss her very much.

content:
なさけ〔情け〕
〈名〉Love; affection; charity; mercy; pity; compassion

content.content: 彼は情けの有る人だ
He is affectionate―charitable―merciful―pitiful―compassionate―He has a feeling heart.
彼は情け知らずだ
He is merciless―pitiless―heartless―He has an unfeeling heart―a heart of stone.
慈悲じゃ情けじゃ
Have mercy on me!
彼は慈悲も情けも無い
He has no mercy or compassion.
義理も情けも無い
He has no heart or conscience.
情け容赦も有らばこそ
Never a particle of mercy has he!
情けをかける

This is something like.
なっちょらん
It is a failure.

content:
なっておる〔成って居る〕
〈自動〉To be good

content.content: この詩はなっておる
This poem is something like.
この作文はなっておらん
This composition is a failure.
あの人の英語はなっている
His English is something like.
この絵はまるでなっておらん
This picture is a dead failure.
この詩はカラなっておらん
The poem is sorry stuff―wretched stuff.

content:
なっとく〔納得〕
〈名〉
1. (=承知)consent; compliance:(=する) to consent (to a proposal); to comply (with a request):(=させる) to make (one) comply; to persuade (one to do something)

content.content: 娘が嫁に行くように納得しました
The girl has consented to get married.
嫁に行くように納得させた
I have persuaded her to get married.
脅したりすかしたりしてやっと納得さした
What by threats, what by entreaties, they finally made her comply.
懇々説諭してようやく納得させました
I have reasoned her into compliance.

content: 2. (=漸く呑込むこと)conviction:(=する) to be convinced (of one's error); to persuade oneself (of a fact):(=させる) to convince (one of one's error)

content.content: 彼の誤りを説いてやったら納得して帰った
I pointed out his error to him, and he went away convinced.
彼と一日議論をしても誤りを納得させかねた
I argued with him all day, but I could not convince him of his error.
あの人がそんな悪いことをしようとはどうしても納得ができぬ
I can not persuade myself that he can be guilty of such a crime―I can not persuade myself of his guilt.

content:
なつば〔夏場〕
〈名〉Summer time; the summer season

content.content: 海岸は夏場だけだ
The seaside is thronged only in the summer season.

content:
なつふく〔夏服〕
〈名〉Summer clothes:(制服なら) summer uniform

content.content: もう夏服か
You are in your summer suit already.

content:
なつまけ〔夏負け〕
〈名〉Susceptibility to summer heat:(=する) to succumb to the heat of summer; to be prostrated by summer heat

content.content: (どうしたかと問われて)夏負けです
I am prostrated by the heat.
君は夏負けするか
Are you susceptible to summer heat?
僕は夏負けしない
I do not suffer from the heat.

なつみかん〔夏蜜柑〕
〈名〉The summer orange; a kind of citron

content:
なつむき〔夏向き〕
〈形〉(A room) for the summer; (an article); for summer use; (a cloth) for summer wear

content.content: この家は夏向きだ
This house is too open.

なつめやし〔棗椰子〕
〈名〉The date-palm

content:
なつもの〔夏物〕
〈名〉Summer goods; summer wear; cloths for the summer season

content.content: 夏物売出し
the opening sale of summer goods

content:
なつやすみ〔夏休み〕
〈名〉The summer vacation; the summer holidays

content.content: 夏休みはどこかへ行くかね
Are you going anywhere during the summer holidays?
去年は夏休み中箱根におった
Last year I stayed at Hakone through the summer vacation.

なつやせ〔夏痩せ〕
〈名〉Loss of flesh in summer:(=する) to lose flesh in summer

content:
なでおろす〔撫で下ろす〕
〈他動〉To stroke down

content.content: (安心して)胸をなでおろした
I breathed again―breathed freely―drew a long breath―gave a sigh of relief―felt a sense of relief.

content:
なでぎり〔撫斬り〕
〈名〉A sweeping conquest; a clean sweep; wholesale slaughter

content.content: 彼は婦人界をなで斬りにした
He made a sweeping conquest of the ladies.
君のことだから女どもをなで斬りにしたろう
You must have made a clean sweep of the girls.
彼は競争者をなで斬りにした
He made a clean sweep of his rivals―swept the field of his rivals.

なでしこ〔撫子〕
〈名〉A kind of pink

content:
なでつけ〔撫付け〕
〈名〉Hair smoothed down:(=る) to smoothe down, comb down (one's hair)

content.content: 彼は髪をなでつけにしている
He wears his hair smoothed down.
鬢をなでつける
to comb down one's sidelocks

content:
なでる〔撫でる〕
〈他動〉To pat; to stroke

content.content: 子どもの頭をなでる
to pat a child on the head
猫の背中をなでる
to stroke a cat on the back
老人が髯をなでて言った
The old man stroked his beard, and said.
額をなでる
to draw one's hand across one's brow
顎をなでる
to pass one's hand across one's chin
外科医が負傷者の全身をなでて骨が折れているかどうかを調べた
The surgeon ran his hands over the body of the wounded, to see if any bones were broken.
髪をなでる
to smoothe down one's hair

content:
など〔抔〕
〈副〉
1. (=等)and so forth; and so on; and the like; and such-like (things) ; and all that; and what not; at cetera

content.content: その箱には紅やら白粉などが入っている
The box contains rouge, powder and so forth―and the like―and all that―and what not.
銃猟や漁猟などのような遊び
shooting, fishing, and such-like sports

content: 2. (=例えば)for example; for instance; for one:(前置詞に訳せば)as for (me) ; such as (these) ; the likes of (me or you)

content.content: 猫など飼ってお置きになりませんか
Don't you keep a cat, for example?
雨降りなどには何をして遊ぶか
How do you amuse yourself in wet weather, for instance?
僕などはどうなろうとかまわぬ
I, for one, don't care what may become of me.
(人はいざ知らず)僕などは何も不平は無い
As for me,―For my part,―I have nothing to complain of.
彼は銃猟や漁猟などのような野外の遊びをせぬ
He does not engage in open-air sports, such as shooting and fishing.
日本には乃木黒木などという名将がある
Japan boasts such famous generals as Nogi and Kuroki.
彼は僕などのような者と付合わない
He does not consort with the likes of me.
私はあなた方などと同席するのはもったいない
It is not for me to sit down with the likes of you.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉
《a》

content.content: 彼は日曜などにやって来ては一日遊んで行く
He will come of a Sunday, and stay all day.
往々朝などに大勢に来られることがある
Sometimes of a morning, I have many people call on me.
彼は死んでしまうなどと言っている
He talks of dying.
学校を止めて洋行するなどと言っている
He talks of leaving school and going abroad.
僕は時々死んでしまおうかなどと思ったことがある
I often thought of dying.
辞職しようかなどと思うことがある
I sometimes think of resigning.
彼女は美人だなどと言えた柄じゃない
She can not pretend to beauty―She has no pretension to beauty.
彼は学者だなどと言えた柄じゃない
He can not pretend to learning―He has no pretension to learning.

content:
《d》
〈訳さぬ場合〉

content.content: 彼は嘘などをつくような人間じゃない
He is not the man to tell a lie.
そんなぜいたくは僕らなどには及びが無い
Such extravagance is beyond our reach.
人の悪口など言うものでない
You should not speak ill of others.

ななくさ〔七草〕
〈名〉
1. The seven herbs (of spring); the seven flowers (of autumn)
2. (=正月の七草) (the festival of) the Seventh of January

content:
ななくせ〔七癖〕
〈名〉Seven faults; seven deadly sins

content.content: 無くて七癖
Everybody has his faults―Nobody is without his faults―Nobody is free from faults.

ななこ〔斜子〕
〈名〉A kind of twilled silk cloth

content:
ななころびやおき〔七転び八起き〕
〈名〉
1. The vicissitudes of fortune

content.content: 世の中は七転び八起きだ
The wheel of Fortune turns round―Fortune will come round―“It is a long lane that has no turning”

content: 2. To have fortitude under misfortune

ななたび〔七度〕
〈副〉Seven times

content.content: 七度尋ねて人を疑え
Be on sure ground before you accuse.

content:
ななつ〔七つ〕
〈名、形〉Seven

content.content: 年は七つです
I am seven (years old)

content:
ななつさがり〔七つ下り〕
〈名〉Declining day; late afternoon

content.content: 七つ下りの着物
seedy clothes―shabby clothes

ななつどうぐ〔七つ道具〕
〈名〉The paraphernalia (of Benkei, of a bride, etc.)

ななつや〔七つ屋〕
〈名〉A pawnbroker's shop; one's uncle's

content:
ななとこがり〔七所借り〕
〈名〉Scraping together (a sum of money):(=する) to scrape together (a required sum of money)

content.content: 七所借りしてやっと百円こしらえた
I have scraped together 100 yen.

content:
ななふしぎ〔七不思議〕
〈名〉Seven wonders

content.content: 世界の七不思議
the Seven Wonders of the World

content:
ななめ〔斜〕
〈形〉Oblique; diagonal; slanting; skew:(=に) obliquely; diagonally; aslant; askew

content.content: 貸家札は斜にはる
The notice of a house to let is posted aslant.

content:
ななめならず〔斜ならず〕
〈副〉Greatly; highly; extremely; exceedingly

content.content: 御感{ぎょかん}斜めならず
His Majesty was highly gratified.
殿は御機嫌斜めならず
My lord was very gracious.

content:
なーに
〈間投詞〉Oh!; Oh no!; Oh, it is nothing!; Why

content.content: なーに、わけありません
Why, it is quite easy.
なーに、まだゆっくりしても大丈です
Oh! there is plenty of time.
なーに、かまうもんか
Oh no! never mind!

content:
なに〔何〕
〈疑問代名詞〉
1. What?:(形容詞を用いても) what (book)?

content.content: 何が欲しいのか
What do you want?
何本が欲しいのか
What book do you want?
何かご用ですか
What is your business (with me)?―What do you want (with me)?
こんなことを覚えて何になるか
What is the use of―Where is the good of―learning such things?
今日は何曜か
What day of the week is this?―What is the day of the week?
お前は何になりつもりか
What are you going to be?
生等の悦び何にか如かん
What can exceed our joy?
この花は英語で何と言いますか
What do you call this flower in English?
「流石」{さすが}ということを英語で何と言いますか
What is the English for “sasuga”?
君は何商売ですか
What (line of) business are you engaged in?―What profession do you follow?―What is your trade?
何が幸せになるかわからないものだ
There is no saying what may turn out to be our blessing.
あの男に何ができるものか
What can he do?―I am blest if he can do anything.
何が何だかわからぬ
I can't tell what is what.
あの人の言うことは何が何だかさっぱりわからぬ
I am at a loss to comprehend what he is driving at.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君は Dickens は何をお読みになりましたか
Which of Dickens's works have you read?
彼は何と思ったか相場に手を出した
He took it into his head to dabble in speculation.
何を隠しましょう女房は臨月です
To be frank with you, my wife is near her time.
あの人は何が好きだって馬ぐらい好きなものは無い
If there is one thing he likes, it is riding.
何が気障{きざ}だって赤ネクタイぐらい気障なものはない
If there is one thing intolerable, it is a red necktie.
世の中には何が偉いたって人の為に死ぬくらい偉いことは無い
If there is one great thing in the world, it is giving one's life for another.

content:
〈不定代名詞〉
1. (=何かの何) something:(疑問なら) anything (?):(形容詞に用いれば) some; any (?)

content.content: 彼には何が気に障ったか怒っている
He is offended at something.
彼は金を何かに使うと言ったか
Did he say he wanted the money for anything?
なんとか始末をつけよう
I'll manage it somehow.
なんとかして事実を突き止めよう
I'll ascertain the fact somehow or other.
心配するな、今になんとかなるよ
Do not make yourself uneasy. Things will come right in time.

content: 2. (=何もの何)nothing:(形容詞に用いれば) no

content.content: 彼は何とも言わない
He said nothing.
何をするとも無く一日暮らした
I passed a day doing nothing―without doing anything.
彼は何をしても成功しない
He succeeds in nothing.
君には何を頼まれてもいやと言えぬ
I can refuse you nothing.
我々の方には何一つ手落ちが無い
Nothing has been neglected―Everything has been performed―on our part.
何を貰ってもそんなことはいやだ
I would not do such a thing for the world―Nothing shall induce me to do such a thing.
あの男は何の役にも立たぬ
He is good for nothing―no good―useless.
いくら骨を折っても何にもならぬ
All my efforts have come to naught.
彼は何の当ても無くうろついている
He wanders about aimlessly―without any definite aim.
何の当ても無く本を開く
to open a book at random

content: 3. (=何でもの何)anything; everything; whatever (you like):(形容詞に用いれば) any; every; whatever; all

content.content: 何なりとも食べたい物をこしらえて上げる
I will get you anything you like―whatever you fancy.
何なりともご遠慮無く召し上がれ
Please help yourself to anything you like―whatever you fancy.
何をするにも身体の丈夫なのが一番だ
Health is the main thing in doing anything.
何をするにも金だ
Money is needed for everything.
英国では何商売でも日曜は休みますか
Do all shops close on Sunday in England?
彼は何をしても失敗する
He fails in everything he does―whatever he undertakes.
なにはさておき、なにはともあれ
above all things―before everything
実業界ではなにはさておき時間を守れ
In business, above all, be punctual.
学生にはなにはともあれ学問が大事だ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
なにをおいても借金を返せ
Pay your debts, before everything.
人はなにはさておき本分を尽すべきものだ
A man should, before everything, do his duty.
朝起きたらなにはさておき冷水浴をなさい
Take a cold douche the first thing in the morning.
何よりも
first of all―of all things
腹がすいたから何よりも飯にしよう
I am hungry. I must eat, first of all.
芝居ですか、何より結構ですね
The play? I shall enjoy it of all things.
学生には健康は何より大事だ
Health is the most important of all things for a student.
人格は何より大事だ
Character is above everything.
何にしろ、何にせよ、何に致せ、何が何でも
anyhow―in any case―at any rate―at all events
何にしろ行ってみよう
I will go anyhow―At any rate, I will go.
何に致せ尽すだけのことは尽しておいた方がよろしい
In any case, it is better to do one's duty.
なにしろ準備だけはしておこう
At any rate, I will make preparations.
何が何でも食わずにゃいられぬ
At all events, I must live.
何を言っても
after all
何を言っても彼は偉い
He is a great man, after all.
何を申しても子どものことですからしかたがありません
You must make allowances, for he is only a child after all.
何につけ(かんにつけ)
everything
何につけても彼女は亡き夫のことばかり思い出している
Everything reminds her of her late husband.
何につけかんにつけ金が要る
Money is needed for everything.
何から何まで
everything―all things
主婦は何から何まで気がつく
The mistress notices everything―Nothing escapes her notice.
人は何から何まで知っているわけにはいかぬ
One can not know all things.
何から何まで幸福な男だ
He is fortunate in everything.
何から何までありがとう存じます
I thank you for thinking of everything.

content: 4. (=何であろうともの何)Whatever (... may...)

content.content: 事の何たるを問わず粗末にするな
Whatever the matter may be,―Be the matter what it may,―do you best.
人は何と言おうとも僕はするだけのことはする
Whatever others may say,―Let others say what they will,―I will do my duty.
何と言っても彼は聴き入れなかった
Whatever I might say,―Say what I would,―he would not listen to me.
何をするにも語学が必要だ
Whatever you may do,―Do what you will,―you will find the knowledge of languages necessary.
あんな奴は何を言って来ても受け付けてはいかん
Whatever he may say, you musk take no notice of it.

content: 〈間投詞〉What!; Oh!

content.content: なに死んだって
What! dead?
なに、かまわん
(Oh!) I don't care
なにかまうものか
No matter!―Never mind!
なに、どうしたって
Great Heavens!
なにそんなことがあるものか
Impossible!

content:
なにか〔何か〕
〈不定代名詞〉Something:(疑問なら) anything?

content.content: この箱に何か入っているか
Is there anything in this box?
何か入っている
There is something in it.
私に何かご用ですか
Do you want anything with me?
何か故障がある
Something is wrong.
彼は病気か何かだろう
He must be sick or something.
あの人は宮内省の何かだ
He is something in the Imperial Household.
何かうまい物は無いか
Have you anything nice?
何か食う物は無いか
Have you anything to eat?
何か飲む物が欲しい
I want something to drink.
何かほかの物を下さい
Give me something else.

content: 〈不定形容詞〉Some:(疑問なら) any?

content.content: 何か本が要るか
Do you want any book?
何か本を貸して下さい
Lend me some book!
君は何か英字新聞を取っているか
Do you take any English paper?
あの人は何か定業があるか

人は何か職業がなくてはならぬ

人は何か取柄があるものだ
A man will have some good in him―something in him―something to recommend him.

content: 〈疑問代名詞〉

content.content: 何かあらん
What if?―What of?
疾病何かあらん

たとい見つかったとて何かあらんだ
What if we are discovered?
王侯将相何かあらん
What of princes and ministers?―“A cat may look at a king”

content:
なにかかにか〔何か彼にか〕
〈不定代名詞〉Something or other; this or that:(形容詞に用いれば) some... or other; this... or that

content.content: あの人はいつもなにかかにかしている

なにかかにか本を読んでいる

この子はいつもなにかかにかいたずらをしている
The boy is always in some mischief or other.

content:
なにがし〔某〕
〈名〉A certain person

content.content: 某様
Mr. So-and-so.
僕は何の某と言われるようになってみせる

content:
なにかしら〔何か知ら〕
〈不定代名詞〉Something or other:(形容詞に用いれば) some... or other

content.content: 彼はしきりに何かしら書いている

A man must have some occupation or other.
さすがに東京だ、何かしら仕事がある
What a wonderful place Tokyo is! One can always find something or other to do.

content:
なにかと〔何かと〕
〈副〉One way or another; in various ways

content.content: 彼は何かとなかなか金を儲ける

何かとお世話になりました

彼はいつも何かと忙しい

なにかなしに〔何かなしに〕
〈副〉Somehow

content:
なにくそっ〔何くそッ〕
〈間投詞〉Damn it!; Hang it!; Dang it!; Dash it!; Damn me!

content.content: 何くそッ俺がやってみせる
Damn me, I'll do it!―By God! I will do it.

content:
なにくれと〔何くれと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なにかと〔何かと〕

content:
なにくわぬかお〔何食わぬ顔〕
〈名〉An innocent look

content.content: 何食わぬ顔をする
to wear an innocent look―put on an innocent air―put a bold face on the matter
彼女は(あんなことをしておきながら)何食わぬ顔をして座敷へ出て来た
She presented herself to the company with an innocent air.
先生が生徒に説明の誤りを摘発されて何食わぬ顔をして曰く「諸君はこの誤りに陥るなかれ」と

content:
なにげなく〔何気無く〕
〈副〉
1. (=故意無く、偶然)unintentionally; inadvertently; casually

content.content: 彼は何気無く言ったのだろうが僕はそれを聞いてギョッとした
I was startled by what he must have said casually.
何気なくしたこと
a casual action―an unintentional action
何気無くしたことをわざとしたように思われた
An unintentional action was thought to be intentional.
何気無く言ったこと
a casual remark―an inadvertent remark
何気無く言ったことが大問題になった
An inadvertent remark of mine gave rise to a great question.

content: 2. (=悪気無く)without malice; innocently

content.content: 僕が何気無く言ったことがたいそうお気に障った
He was highly offended at what I had said without any malice.
何気無く装う
to put on an innocent air
彼女は何気無いふうを装って座敷へ出て来た
She presented herself to the company with an innocent air.

content:
なにごころなく〔何心無く〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なにげなく〔何気無く〕

content:
なにごと〔何事〕
〈疑問詞〉What?

content.content: 何事か
What is the matter?―What is up?―What has gone wrong?
(人を叱って)これは何事か
What is all this?
あの音はいったい何事だろう
What on earth can that noise mean?
この夜更に来るとは何事だ
What do you mean by coming at this time of night?
その振舞は何事だ
What do you mean by behaving in that manner?
四百余州に一人無しとは何事ぞ
What a shame that the broad realm should be unable to show one man!
いやしくも紳士たるもののあの挙動は何事ぞ
What a shame that anything of a gentleman should behave like that!
何事のおはします
I know not what it is that moves
かは知らねども
My heart to such a mood;
忝けなさに
But yet my tears unbidden flow
涙こぼるる
In blissful gratitude

content:
〈不定代名詞〉
1. (=何事か) something:(疑問なら) anything?

content.content: 何事か起こったのか
Has anything happened?
何事かあったらしい
Something seems to have happened.

content: 2. (=何事も)nothing

content.content: 何事も無い
Nothing has happened―Nothing is the matter―Nothing is wrong―All is right―All is well.
何事も無く
without any accident―without mishap―without mischance―very well―quietly
厄日は何事も無くすんだ
The critical day has passed without any accident―passed quietly.
運動会は何事も無くすんだ
The field day has gone off very well―gone off without mishap.
彼は何事にも驚かない
Nothing can discompose him.
何事にも腹を立てない
Nothing can ruffle him.
何事にも動じない
Nothing can perturb him―He is imperturbable.

content: 3. (=何事でも)anything; everything; all things

content.content: 何事でもあったら知らして下さい
If anything happens, please let me know.
何事を措いても
above all things―before everything
御身に変があったら何事を措ても駆けつけます
If anything should happen to you, I would hasten to you before everything.
実業界へ入ったら何事を措いても時間を守れ
In business, above all, be punctual.

content: 4. (=何事であろうとも)whatever (may)

content.content: 何事によらず粗末にするな
Whatever the matter may be,―Be the matter what it may,―do your best.
何事があろうとも覚悟をきめている
Whatever may happen,―Come what may,―Come weal or woe,―I am prepared for it.

content:
なにさま〔何様〕
〈副〉So (that)

content.content: なにさま天気が悪いので戸の口一寸も出られない
The weather is so bad that there is no stirring an inch out of doors.

なにしおう〔名にし負う〕
〈形〉Noted; famed; famous; renowned; celebrated

content:
なにとぞ〔何卒〕
〈副〉If you please; please (do so); be pleased (to do so)

content.content: 皆様へ宜敷御伝言被下度候
Please give my best regards to your people.
何卒御許可被下度此段奉願上候{なにとぞごきょかくだされたくこのだんねがいあげたてまつりそうろう}
You will be pleased to grant me permission.
何卒何卒叶わせ給え
God grant that it may be so!

なにとて〔何とて〕
〈疑問副詞〉Why?; How is it that?

content:
なになに〔何々〕
〈不定代名詞〉So-and-so

content.content: 一つ、何々
Item So-and-so.

content: 〈間投詞〉What is this?; What do I see?

content.content: 何々、「書き置きの事」
What is this? “A dying confession”?

content:
なにはさておき〔何は措き〕
〈副〉Above all things; before everything; first of all

content.content: 学生にはなにはさておき学問が大事だ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
実業界ではなにはさておき時間を守れ
In business, before everything, be punctual!
しかしなにはさておき人間になれ
But, first of all, be a man!
朝起きたらなにはさておきこれをなさい
Do it the first thing in the morning!

content:
なにはともあれ〔何はともあれ〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なにはさておき〔何は措き〕

content:
なにふじゆうなく〔何不自由無く〕
〈副〉In plenty

content.content: 何不自由無く暮らす
to live in plenty―live at one's ease

content:
なにふそくなく〔何不足無く〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なにふじゆうなく〔何不自由無く〕

content:
なにぶん〔何分〕
〈副〉
1. (=なるべく)as much as possible

content.content: なにぶん気をつけて下さい
You will be as careful as you can.
なにぶん多くして下さい
Make it as much as possible.
なにぶん早く来て下さい
Come as soon as possible.
なにぶん早い方が好い
The sooner the better.
なにぶんそう致します
I will do my best.

content: 2. (=どうか)please

content.content: なにぶんよろしくお願い申します
You will please exert yourself in my behalf―(と言うよりも普通は)―My affair is safe in your hands―(同僚になるべき人の初対面の挨拶なら)―I hope we shall have a good time together
まことに行き届かない者ですがなにぶんよろしくお願い申します
I shall place this raw boy under your care.
なにぶん頼む
Please do your best―I shall rely on you for the performance of the task.
なにぶんよろしく頼む
I leave it to your judgement.

content: 3. (=にも)(=なんとしても)in no way

content.content: なにぶんにも人が無いので困ります
I can in no way get enough men.
なにぶんにも代りが無いので止めるわけにいきません
I can in no way find a man to take my place, and I can not leave.

content: 〈形〉(=の) some

content.content: なにぶんの回答をする
to give some answer
事実取調べの上なにぶんのお返事を致します
I shall give you an answer after inquiring into the facts.

content:
なにほど〔何程〕
〈疑問副詞〉→『

content.content: いくら〔幾ら〕

content:
なにも〔何も〕
〈不定代名詞〉Nothing

content.content: 財布に何も入っていない
There is nothing in the purse.
何も知らない
I know nothing―I do not know anything.
何も故障は無い
Nothing is wrong.
あの男は何も役に立たない
He is good for nothing.
僕は何も用は無い
I have nothing to do.
何も食う物は無い
There is nothing to eat.
何もうまい物は無い
There is nothing nice.
ほかに何も無い
There is nothing else.
僕は何も不平は無い
I have nothing to complain of.
何もご馳走はありません
We have nothing to offer you―You must put up with poor fare―Ours is but humble fare.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 子どもらは課業も何も忘れて遊びに夢中になっている
The children are absorbed in play, forgetful of everything.
彼は商売も何も打捨てて新事業にかかった
He sacrificed everything to the new undertaking.
こうなると規則も何もあったものじゃない
When things come to this, all rules are useless.
放蕩を始めたら忠告も何もあったものじゃない
When one falls into evil courses, all advice is vain.
金儲けとなると義理も何もあったものじゃない
All gratitude is forgotten in the scramble for money.
金さえあれば何も要らぬと言う人あり
Money is everything―Money is the one thing needful.

content: 〈不定形容詞〉No

content.content: あの人は何も定業が無い
He has no regular occupation.
あの勉強家が成功したのは何も不思議は無い
It is no wonder that such a hard-working man should have succeeded.

content: 〈疑問副詞〉Why (should)?

content.content: 何も憚る必要はあるまい
Why should I fear?―There is no reason why I should fear.
何も僕だって成功できぬという理由はあるまい
Why should I not succeed?―I see no reason why I should not succeed.
何もこの金を使って悪いというわけはあるまい
Why should I not spend this money?―I can see no reason why I should not spend this money.

content:
なにもかも〔何も彼も〕
〈不定代名詞〉Everything; anything and everything; all:(形容詞に用いれば) every; any and every; all

content.content: 何もかも知っている
I know everything―I know all.
何もかも手違いになった
Everything has gone wrong.
彼は何もかも自分でする
He does everything for himself.
彼は何もかも白状してしまった
He has confessed everything―made a clean breast of the affair.
彼は専門に関することは何もかも研究している
He has studied anything and everything relating to his profession.
専門に関する詳細の点まで何もかも極めている
He has mastered any and every detail of his profession.
子どもらは課業も何もかも打忘れて遊びに夢中になっている
The children are absorbed in play, forgetful of everything.
彼は商売も何もかも打捨てて新事業にかかった
He sacrificed everything to the new undertaking.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は何もかも承知している
He knows what he is about―He understands his business―He is wide-awake―He is a knowing fellow.
彼は何もかも承知の上で放蕩をしている
He lives a fast life with open eyes.

content:
なにもの〔何者〕
〈疑問代名詞〉What (man)?; Who?

content.content: 彼は何者か
What is he?
君は相手は何者なるかを知っているだろう
You must know whom you have to deal with.
何者の仕業だかたいがいわかっている
I have a shrewd guess as to whose doing it is.
(その人)何者なるかの問題
the identity (of the man)
犯人は何者なるか手掛り無し
There is no clue to the identity of the culprit.

content:
なにものか〔何者か〕
〈不定代名詞〉Some one; somebody

content.content: 彼は何者かの手にかかって死んだ
He died by somebody's hand―died by some unknown hand.

content:
なにやかや〔何や彼や〕
〈不定代名詞〉Something or other; one thing or another; this and that; sundries

content.content: なにやかやで忙しい
I am busy with something or other.
彼はなにやかやでなかなか金を儲ける
He makes much money one way and another.
今月はなにやかやで物入りが多かった
I have had many outlays one way and another this month.
なにやかやで一週間かかった
It took me a week to do one thing or another.
なにやかやで百円はかかる
It will cost 100 yen, inclusive of sundries.

content:
なにやら
〈不定代名詞〉Something; something or other

content.content: 彼は何やらやっている
He is doing something or other―I know not what―God knows what.
何やらさん
Mr. What's-your-name!
あの何やらいうもの
that what-do-you-call-it―that thingumbob

content:
なにやらかやら〔何やら彼やら〕
〈不定代名詞〉→『

content.content: なにやかや〔何や彼や〕

content: 』(接尾語に用いれば) and what not; and all that; and all the rest of it

content.content: 箱には紅やら白粉やら何やらかやら入っている
The box contains rouge, powder, and what not.

なにゆえ〔何故〕
〈疑問副詞〉Why?; Wherefore?

content:
なにようび〔何曜日〕
〈疑問詞〉What day of the week?

content.content: 今日は何曜日か
What day of the week is this?―What is the day of the week?

content:
なにより〔何より〕
〈副〉First of all; of all things; above all things; before everything; nothing better

content.content: ご無事かそりゃ何よりだ
Are you well? I am glad of it.
腹が減ったから何よりまず飯にしよう
I am hungry Let us eat, first of all!
芝居ですか、そりゃ何より結構です
The play? I shall enjoy it of all things.
学生には何より学問が大事だ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
人は何よりまず本分を尽すべきものだ
A man should, before everything, do his duty.
人格は何より大事だ
Character is the most important of all things.
丈夫なのは何よりだ
Health is above everything else.
お丈夫なのは何より結構です
I am glad to see you in the enjoyment of good health.
それは何より好きです
I like nothing better.
銃猟は何より好きです
I like nothing better than shooting.

content: 〈形〉Nice (present); handsome (gift, etc.)

content.content: 何よりの品を頂戴してありがたく存じます
Thank you for your beautiful present!

content:
なにら〔何等〕
〈不定代名詞〉Nothing whatever:(形容詞に用いれば)no whatever

content.content: 何等の証拠無し
There is no proof whatever.
これとそれとは何等の関係無し
This has nothing whatever to do with that.
彼は何等の理由無くして去った
He has left without any reason whatever.

content: 〈感嘆形容詞〉What (a)...!

content.content: 何等の幸運ぞ
What good fortune!―How fortunate!

なにわぶし〔浪花節〕
〈名〉A kind of story-telling, with an intermixture of recitatives in a peculiar voice

なぬし〔名主〕
〈名〉The headman (of a village)

content:
なのある〔名の有る〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: なだかい〔名高い〕

content:
なのか〔七日〕
〈名〉Seven days:(何月七日) the seventh (of January, etc.)

content.content: 初七日
the seventh day of one's death

content:
なのみ〔名のみ〕
〈形、副〉→『

content.content: なばかり〔名計り〕

content:
なのり〔名乗〕
〈名〉
1. (A samurai's) true name, second name

content.content: 名乗り上げる
to announce one's name―(立候補を宣するの意味なら)―announce oneself as a candidate―announce one's candidature
親類名乗
claims of kindred
親類名乗をする
to claim kindred with one―call cousins with one

なのりあう〔名乗り合う〕
〈自動〉To introduce themselves to each other; to make themselves known to each other

content:
なのりでる〔名乗り出る〕
〈自動〉
1. To make oneself known (to somebody); to introduce oneself (to somebody); to discover oneself (to somebody); to reveal oneself (to somebody)
2.

content.content: 自ら(警察へ)名乗り出る
to give oneself up to the authorities―surrender oneself to justice

content:
なのる〔名乗る〕
〈他動〉
1. To bear (some name)

content.content: 彼は源の姓を名乗っている
He bears the name of Minamoto.
源の姓を名乗って仕官した
He took service under the name of Minamoto.

content: 2. (=世に名乗る)to profess (a calling or a religion)

content.content: 彼は弁護士になり世に名乗っている
He professes law―professes himself to be a lawyer.
キリスト教信者なりと世に名乗っている
He professes himself to be a Christian―professes Christianity.

content: 3. (=名乗り出る)to make oneself known, discover oneself (to somebody)

なばかり〔名計り〕
〈形〉Nominal; titular:(副詞に訳せば)only in name; in nothing but the name

content.content: 彼は名ばかりの校長だ
He is a nominal principal―a titular principal.
学者とは名ばかり
He is a scholar only in name―in nothing but the name.

content:
なびかせる〔靡かせる〕
〈他動〉To make (one) yield; to seduce (a woman); to win over, gain over (a man)

content.content: 女をなびかせる
to seduce a woman
人を金でなびかせる
to win one over by money―gain one over by money

content:
なびく〔靡く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=風になびく)to bend (to the wind)

content.content: 柳は風になびく
The willow bends to the wind―bends before the wind.
王師の向かうところ草木の風になびくが如し
The Imperial army carries everything before it.

content: 2. (=翻る)to wave, fly, float, stream (in the wind)

content.content: 日の丸が門になびいている
The sun-flag waves over the gate.
国旗が檣頭になびいている
The national flag flies from the mast-head.

content: 3. (=従う)to bend, bow, yield, submit (to one)

content.content: 人の心になびく
to bend to one's will―yield to one―submit to one
女が男になびく
A woman yields to a man―bestows her favours on a man.
彼女は彼になびいている
She is at his feet.
女をなびかせる
to seduce a woman
金でなびかせる
to win one over by money―gain one over by money
彼は金でなびく男でない
He is not the man to be won over by money.
女は男に口説かれてなびいた(口説き落とされた)
She was wooed and won.
隣国は皆覆王になびいた
The neighbouring countries all bowed to his yoke.

なびろめ〔名弘め〕
〈名〉Announcement of a newly-assumed name

content:
なふだ〔名札〕
〈名〉
1. (=名刺)→『

content.content: めいし〔名刺〕
ひょうさつ〔標札〕

なぶりごろし〔嬲り殺し〕
〈名〉Torturing to death:(=にする) to torture (one) to death; to kill (one) by inches

content:
なぶりもの〔嬲りもの〕
〈名〉A mock; a mockery; a butt

content.content: 人をなぶりものにする
to make a mock of a man
彼は学校中のなぶりものになっている
He is the butt of the whole school.

content:
なぶる〔嬲る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=愚弄する)to mock; to tease; to tantalize; to roast; to quiz; to make sport of (one); to laugh (one) to scorn

content.content: たんと人をおなぶりなさいまし
Mock me as much as you like!
さんざんなぶられた
I was laughed to scorn.
欲しがるものを見せつけてそれは人をなぶるというものだ
You are tantalizing me with the mere sight of what I long for.
あの人は人をなぶることが上手だ
He is a quiz.

content: 2. (=もてあそぶ)to play with (anything)

なべ〔鍋〕
〈名〉(深い鍋)a pot:(浅い鍋)a pan

content.content: 鍋を掛ける
to put a pot over the fire
鍋で煮る
to boil anything in a pot
フライ鍋
a frying pan
シチュー鍋
a stew-pan―a stew-pot
鍋の蓋
a pot-lid
鍋の鉉
the bail of a pot―a pot-handle
鍋を掛ける鉤
a pot-hook
割れ鍋に綴じ蓋
“Every Jack has his Jill.”

なべかま〔鍋釜〕
〈名〉Pot and pan; kitchen utensils

なべづる〔鍋鶴〕
〈名〉A kind of crane

なべやきうどん〔鍋焼饂飩〕
〈名〉Pot-boiled macaroni

content:
なへん〔那辺〕
〈疑問副詞〉Where?

content.content: 困難は那辺に存するか
Where does the difficulty lie?
彼の真意のはたして那辺に存するやを解するに苦しむ
I am at a loss to comprehend what his real intention is.

content:
なま〔生ま〕
〈形〉
1. (=煮焼きせぬ)raw (fish or meat)

content.content: 生卵
a raw egg
魚を生で食う
We eat fish raw.
このビフテキは生だ
This beefsteak is raw.

content: 2. (=枯れない)green, unseasoned (wood)

content.content: 生薪
green wood―wood in the green
生木で造った家は狂う
A house built of unseasoned wood will go crazy.
生傷
a fresh wound―a green wound
生ビール
draught-beer―beer on draught―beer on tap
なまいき〔生意気〕

content:
』
〈名〉(=現なま)hard money; hard cash

content.content: 生で欲しいだろう
You would like it in cash―in the hard.

content:
なまいき〔生意気〕
〈名〉Impertinence; conceit; coxcombry:(言うことの生意気) sauce; cheek:(=な) impertinent, conceited (fellow); saucy, pert, perky (miss); cocky, cocksy, coxy (boy); proud (girl); pretending, pretentious (residence); smartish (dress, etc.)

content.content: 生意気な奴だ
He is an impertinent fellow―a conceited fellow―a coxcomb.
ずいぶん生意気だ
Confound his, impertinence!―I like his impertinence.
生意気で手がつけられない
He is too conceited for anything―conceited enough for everybody.
生意気な小僧だ
What a puppy! What a jackanapes!
生意気な餓鬼だ
What a saucy girl!―What a pert minx!
あの娘は生意気だ
She is a proud girl.
生意気言う
to talk impertinence
貴様は生意気なことを言う
What impertinence you talk!
生意気言うな
None of your sauce!―None of your cheek!
生意気言ってら
How big he talks!―Hear him talk!
彼は生意気にもそんなことを言った
He was so impertinent as to say so―He had the impertinence to say so.
彼は生意気な家に住んでいる
He lives in a pretentious house.
馬車で歩くとは生意気だ
It is pretending of him to ride in a carriage.
生意気な英語を使うね
He speaks smartish English.
この英語は生意気だ
The English is something like.

content:
なまえ〔名前〕
〈名〉A name

content.content: お名前は
What is your name?―May I ask your name?
彼は生徒の名前を一々知っている
He knows every one of the students by name.
人の名前を呼ぶ
to call a man by name

content:
なまえい〔生ま酔い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: なまよい〔生ま酔い〕

なまおぼえ〔生覚え〕
〈名〉A smattering

なまがくしゃ〔生ま学者〕
〈名〉A smatterer; a sciolist; a dilettante

content:
なまがくもん〔生ま学問〕
〈名〉Imperfect knowledge; smattering (knowledge); sciolism; dilettantism

content.content: 生学問を振りまわす
to parade one's smattering knowledge

content:
なまかじり〔生囓り〕
〈名〉A smattering; sciolism; dilettantism:(=する) to get a smattering of (English); to dip into (a subject)

content.content: あの人はなまかじりだ
He is a smatterer―a sciolist―a dilettante.
彼の英語はなまかじりだ
He has a smattering of English.
彼はなんでもかでもなまかじりする
He dips into everything.
なんでもかでもなまかじりしている
He knows a bit of everything.

なまがわ〔生ま皮〕
〈名〉A raw hide; hides in the raw

content:
なまき〔生ま木〕
〈名〉(薪なら) green wood:(材木なら) unseasoned wood:(生きた木の意味なら) a live tree

content.content: 生木だからくすぶる
The wood is green and smoulders.
生木で造った家は狂う
A house built of unseasoned wood will go crazy.
生木を裂くよう
to part lovers

content:
なまぎき〔生ま聞き〕
〈名〉Imperfect hearing

content.content: 生聞きで請合うからこんな間違いをしでかすのだ
You make such mistakes, because you undertake anything before hearing one out.

content:
なまきず〔生ま傷〕
〈名〉A fresh wound; a green wound

content.content: 彼は身体に生傷が絶えぬ
He never has a whole skin.

content:
なまくさい〔生ま臭い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: なまぐさい〔生臭い〕

content:
なまぐさい〔生臭い〕
〈形〉Fishy (smell)

content.content: 彼は生臭い物を食わぬ
He abstains from fish.

content:
なまくさぼうず〔生臭坊主〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: なまぐさぼうず〔生臭坊主〕

なまぐさぼうず〔生臭坊主〕
〈名〉An unholy priest

なまくび〔生ま首〕
〈名〉A head just severed from the trunk

なまくら

“The lazy man begins to be busy towards evening”

〈自動〉To idle; to be idle; to laze; to be lazy; to loaf; to drone; to relax one's attention; to relax one's efforts; to slacken one's efforts

content.content: 君は怠けてばかりいる
You are always idle―always idling―always loafing.
(学問は)少し怠けると逆戻りする
Relax your efforts ever so little, and you go backward.
彼は怠けて日を暮らしている
He idles his time away.
この夏は怠けて暮らした
I have idled away the summer.
僕は怠けていられない
I can not afford to be idle.
この世の中は怠けて暮らせる世の中ではない
This is not a world where we can afford to be idle.
怠けずにしっかりやれ
Work hard!―Bestir yourself!

content:
なまじ〔憖〕
〈副〉By halves; (not) at all; (not) ever:(=の) half; petty; paltry; indifferent (etc.)

content.content: なまじっかやるなら止した方が好い
If you do things by halves, you had better leave them undone.
なまじ知らない方が好い
It is better not to know at all (than to know by halves)
なまじ知っているとかえって悪い
A half knowledge will do you more harm than good.
若い者はなまじ財産など無い方が好い
It is better for a young man to have no fortune at all(than a paltry one)
なまじ財産が有ると若い者にはかえって毒だ
The possession of a paltry fortune will be rather injurious than otherwise to a young man.
青年はなまじ世話をしない方が好い
It is better not to help a young man at all(than to give him indifferent help)
なまじ世話をすると青年は依頼心を起こす
Indifferent help will only serve to make a young man depend on others.
なまじっか位などは無い方が好い
It is better to have no rank at all (than a petty one)
なまじ位が有ると窮屈だ
A petty rank will deprive one of freedom.
君にはなまじっか逢わなけりゃ好かった
I wish I had never met you―I am sorry I ever met you―I am sorry I met you at all.
なまじっか逢ったものだからこの苦労
Our meeting at all has caused me this trouble.
女中はなまじ東京慣れた者よりも山出しの方が好い
A maid fresh from the country is better than one indifferently used to the ways of the town.
なまじ素人の婀娜{あだ}者よりもかえって芸者の方が好い
I prefer a bona-fide professional geisha to a half-professional coquette.
こんな品はなまじっかな金では買えぬ
The article is not to be had for a paltry sum.
恋にはなまじ連れは邪魔
“Love likes not fellow-ship”

田舎訛り
a rustic dialect―a provincialism
彼は時々お国訛りを出す
He often betrays his provincialism.
あの人はむき出しの奥州訛りだ
He speaks a broad Oshu dialect.

a Briticism

“Pan” is a corrupted form―a corruption―of the French “pain”.
あの人の言葉は少し訛る
He speaks with a slight accent.

content:
なみ〔波、浪〕
〈名〉A wave:(大波) a billow; a swell:(小波) a ripple:(寄せ波) the surf; the surge:(はるか沖の方から寄せ来る波) a beachcomber:(岩に砕ける白波) a breaker:(波が高い低いの波) the sea

content.content: 波が立つ
The sea gets up.
波が立っている
The sea is up.
風が吹くと波が立つ
The wind causes the sea to get up―A gale lashes the sea into fury.
波が静まる
The sea goes down.
波が高い
The sea is running high―A high sea is running.
波が高くて舟が出せない
The sea is running too high for a boat to put off.
波が山のように高い
The sea runs mountain high.
山のような波
a mountain of a wave
波が荒い
The sea is rough.
こう波が荒くては水舟になってしまう
The boat will be swamped in such a rough sea.
波が岸を打つ
The sea beats against the shore.
波が岸に砕ける
The sea breaks on the beach.
船が波をかぶった
We shipped a sea.
船が波間に漂う
A ship drifts at the mercy of the waves.
船が浪に翻弄される
A ship is tossed about by the sea.
船が波を切る
A ship cuts a feather.
船が波を蹴立てて進む
A ship dashes the waves aside―dashes forward.
浪と戦う
to buffet the waves
浪にもまれる
to be buffeted by the sea
世の荒浪にもまれる
to be buffeted by the world
平地に浪を起こす
to force a war―force the situation
浪の音
the roar of the sea―(遠方なら)―the booming of the breakers
彼は浪の音の聞こえる処に住む
He likes to live within hearing of the sea.
浪の峯
the crest of a wave
波と波の間の谷
a trough of the sea
浪の崩れ
a breach―(甲板を越して物をさらって行く波の崩れ)―a clear breach―(甲板を越しながら砕けずに行く波の崩れ)―a clean breach
(砂の上などの)波の跡
a ripple-mark→『なみうつ〔波打つ〕』→『なみだつ〔波立つ〕』

content:
なみ〔並〕
〈形〉
1. Common; ordinary; average; normal; medium; mediocre; middling:(名詞に訳せば) the common run, the generality (of men, etc.)

content.content: 彼は並みの人間だ
He is an ordinary individual―an ordinary mortal―a man of average ability―He belongs to the common run of men.
並みの品だ
It is a common article―an article of average quality―(集合的に言えば)―They are middlings
あの人の才能は並みだ、ごく並みだ
He is a man of normal abilities―a man of mediocre talents―a mediocrity.
並みの才能の有る人ならこの任に堪える
A man of normal abilities will be equal to the task.
並み以上
above the average
彼は並み以上の才能を持っている
He is endowed with talents above the average.
器量は並みだ(十人並)
She is a woman of passable charms―She is passably good-looking―She will pass in a crowd.
器量は並以上だ
She has personal charms above the average.
あの人の背は並みだ
He is of the average height―of the medium height.
背は並みよりも高い
He is above the average height.
あの先生は並み以上だ
He is above the common run of teachers―above the generality of teachers.
並みをはずれている
to be abnormal―extraordinary―out of the common
あの人は並みの人間と違う処がある、どこか並みでない処がある
There is something peculiar about him.
あの人は並みはずれて大きい
He is of an abnormal size―quite a giant.
彼の才能は並みはずれだ
He is gifted with extraordinary talents.
細君は並みでない身体になっている(妊娠している)
His wife is in the family way―in an interesting condition.
これを皆覚えるのは並みたいていのことじゃない
It is no easy task―a Herculean task―to learn all this.
子どもを一人育てるのは並みたいていの苦労じゃない
It is no common trouble―no easy thing―to bring up a child.
お前のために並みたいていの心配じゃなかった
You have caused me no small anxiety.
世間並みから言えば良い先生だ
He is a good teacher, as teachers go―as the would goes.
世間並みでは好い亭主をもっている
She has a good husband, as husbands go―as the world goes.
僕も人間並みに風邪を引いた
I have caught my cold.
彼は人間並みに笑いもするし泣きもする
He laughs his laugh and cries his cry.

content:
なみあし〔並足〕

content.content: 並み足で進んだ

The floor undulates.

a rolling plain
胸や腹に波うたせる
to heave the chest―heave the belly
田は黄金の波うっている

The family is subject to constant troubles―in a chronic state of disturbance.

to create a disturbance

〈名〉A row of trees; an avenue

a road bordered with pines
宮へ行く路は杉の並木になっている
An avenue of cryptomerias lead to the shrine.
並木を見通す景色
a vista

content:

〈名〉A voyage; a passage (across the sea)

content.content: 波路はるかに訪れ来る

content:
なみする〔蔑する〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: けいべつ〔軽蔑〕

content:
なみだ〔涙〕
〈名〉A tear:(通例は複数) tears:(感傷の涙) sentiment

content.content: 涙を流す、涙をこぼす
to shed tears
嬉し涙を流す
to shed tears of joy―cry tears of joy―weep tears of joy
ありがた涙を流す
to shed tears of gratitude―cry tears of gratitude―weep tears of gratitude
血の涙を流す
to shed bitter tears―cry bitter tears―weep bitter tears
彼のために血の涙を流す
My heart bleeds for him.
熱い涙を流す
to shed hot tears―cry scalding tears
空涙を流す
to cry crocodile tears
涙を流さざるを得ない
I can not refrain from tears.
哀れな話を聞いて皆涙を流した
The pitiful story moved as all to tears.
この歌を聞いて涙を流さずにおれない
I can not listen to the song with dry eyes.
聴衆の中に涙を流さない者は一人も無かった
There was not a dry eye in the audience.
涙を流して頼んだ
She implored with tears in her eyes.
涙をこぼして、涙ながらに、涙片手に物語った
She told her story with tears.
泣きの涙で別れた
We parted in tears.
ほろりと涙をこぼした
She dropped a tear.
はらはらと涙を流した
Tears fell in drops.
涙がこぼれる、目に涙が出る
The tears fall―The tears flow―The tears come into one's eyes―One's eyes water.
聞くと涙がこぼれる
The story is affecting―touching―pathetic―The story brings the tears to my eyes―makes my eyes water.
何事のおはします
I know not what it is that moves
かは知らねども
My heart to such a mood;
忝けなさに
But yet my tears unbidden fall
涙こぼるる
In blissful gratitude.
思い出すと涙が出る
The thought brings the tears to my eyes―makes my eyes water.
あまり笑って涙が出た
I laughed till the tears came―laughed till I cried.
聞いて目に涙
The tears come into my eyes at the story―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The story brings the tears into my eyes
山葵{わさび}が利いたか目に涙
The mustard has brought the tears into my eyes.
鬼の目に涙
to wring tears from the hardest heart
涙を絞る
to wring tears from one―strain a tear
涙が先に立つ
The tears will come into my eyes.
両目に涙を湛える(涙ぐむ)
One's eyes dim with tears―glisten with tears―swim with tears.
涙ぐんだ目
tearful eyes―swimming eyes
涙ぐんだ目で僕の顔を見た
She looked me in the face with tearful eyes―with swimming eyes.
目にいっぱい涙をためていた
Her eyes filled with tears―Her eyes were suffused with tears.
彼の目には涙が溢れていた
His eyes were streaming with tears.
涙の溢れる目
streaming eyes
目に涙が宿る
Tears stand in one's eyes―A tear stands in one's eye.
涙に暮れる
to be drowned in tears―dissolved in tears
女は明け暮れ涙にかき暮れている
She does nothing but cry night and day.
涙にむせぶ
to be choked with tears―(感泣するの意味なら)―shed tears of gratitude
無念の涙にむせぶ
to be mortified―chagrined
泫然{げんぜん}として涙下る
The tears stream down one's cheeks.
涙が滝のように流れる
The tears gush from one's eyes.
涙数行
The tears roll down one's cheeks.
涙を呑む
to choke down one's tears―gulp down one's tears―keep back one's tears―smother one's tears―repress one's tears
涙を呑んで侮辱を忍んだ
I repressed my tears and swallowed the insult.
涙を揮って馬謖{ばしょく}を斬る
to sacrifice love to principle
涙を揮って彼を免職した
I dismissed him at the sacrifice of my sentiment.
涙を催す
to melt into tears―be moved to tears
この唄を聞くと涙を催す
The song moves me to tears―makes my eyes water.
涙を払う
to brush away the tears―brush a tear from one's eye
涙を拭く
to wipe one's eyes―dry one's tears―wipe the tears from one's eyes
涙の種だ
It is matter for tears.
思い出しても涙の種
The thought makes me cry.
彼は涙に声を曇らした
He lost his voice in tears.
女は涙が多い
Women are sentimental.
涙は女の武器
Tears are woman's weapon.
涙を誘う光景
a pathetic scene
血も涙も有る人
an impulsive man
血も涙も無い人
a cold-blooded man
雀の涙ほどの火酒
a thimbleful of brandy―a toothful of brandy
君はまだ遠くは
Thou canst not yet
行かじ我袖の
Be far from here―
袂の涙
Still moist on my sleeve
乾き果てねば
Is the parting tear

なみだあめ〔涙雨〕
〈名〉
1. (=微雨)a few drops of rain
2. (=別れを惜しむ雨)the rain that falls at parting

content:
なみたいてい〔並大抵〕
〈形〉(No) common

content.content: 子どもを一人育てるのはなみたいていの苦労じゃない
It is no common trouble―no easy thing―to bring up a child.
お前のためになみたいていの心配じゃなかった
You have caused me no small anxiety.
これを皆覚えるのはなみたいていのことじゃない
It would be no easy task―a Herculean task―to learn all this.

content.content: 別れる時女は涙ぐんだ
When they parted, her eyes glistened with tears―the tears glistened in her eyes.
涙ぐんだ目
tearful eyes―swimming eyes
彼女は涙ぐんで僕の顔を見た
She looked me in the face with tearful eyes―with swimming eyes.

なみだごえ〔涙声〕
〈名〉A tearful voice

content.content: 波立てる海
a rolling sea

なみだもろい〔涙脆い〕
〈形〉Sentimental; maudlin; tearful; lachrymose

content.content: 女は涙脆い
Girls are sentimental―Woman are easily moved to tears.

content:
なみなみ〔波々〕
〈副〉(To fill) to the brim

content.content: 波々と酒を注ぐ
to a fill a cup to the brim
波々と注いだ盃
a brimming cup

なみなみならぬ〔並々ならぬ〕
〈形〉Uncommon

content.content: 並み並みならぬお世話になりました
You have shown me no common kindness.

content:
なみはずれ〔並外れ〕
〈形〉Abnormal; extraordinary; uncommon; out of the common:(=る) to be abnormal; to be extraordinary; to be out of the common

content.content: あの人はどこか並みはずれたところがある
There is something out of the common about him.
並みはずれて大きい
He is of an abnormal size―quite a giant.
彼の才能は並みはずれだ
He is endowed with uncommon talents―gifted with extraordinary powers.

content:
なみひととおり〔並一と通り〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: なみたいてい〔並大抵〕

content:
なみまに〔波間に〕
〈副〉Among the waves

content.content: 船が波間に漂う
A ship drifts at the mercy of the waves.

なみよけ〔波除け〕
〈名〉
1. (=防波堤)a breakwater
2. (=船の波除け)a bulwark

なむあみだぶつ〔南無阿弥陀仏〕
〈呼掛名詞〉O Buddha!:(死んだ人について唱えれば) May his soul rest in peace!

content:
なむさん〔南無三〕

content.content: 南無三しまった
Hang it! the game is up.

なむさんぼう〔南無三宝〕

content.content: なむさん〔南無三〕

なめ〔縵面〕
〈名〉The reverse, the tail (of a coin)

content.content: なめかかたか
Head or tail?
かたなら勝ち、なめなら負け
Heads, you win; tails, you lose.

content:
なめくじ〔蛞蝓〕

content.content: なめくじに塩を掛けたよう
to be cast down―dejected―crest-fallen

なめしがわ〔鞣皮〕
〈名〉(Tanned) leather

なめす〔鞣す〕
〈他動〉To tan (hides); to dress (skins)

content:
なめらか〔滑か〕
〈形〉Smooth; glassy

content.content: 象牙は滑かだ
Ivory is smooth.
滑かな海
a glassy sea
滑かに走る
to run smooth―glide―bowl along
滑かにする
to smoothe

content:
なめる〔舐める、嘗める〕
〈他動〉
1. To lick; to lap

content.content: 犬が人の足をなめる
A dog licks your feet.
猫が牛乳をなめる
A cat laps up milk.
皿をなめる
to lick the dish clean
猛火は近隣をなめ尽した
The devouring element licked up the whole neighbourhood.
子どもをなめるように可愛がる
to dote on a child
始めは飴をなめさしておく
I give him line at first.
ちょいとなめたが身のつまり
A single taste of pleasure was my ruin.

content: 2. (=試味する)to taste

content.content: 汁をなめてみる(塩梅見る)
to taste the soup
純金はなめてみると味の無いのでわかる
Pure gold is known by the absence of taste.

content: 3. (=経験する)to experience

content.content: 艱難をなめた
I have seen hardships―gone through hardships.
世の辛酸をなめる
to taste the sweets and bitters of life―go through the roughs and smooths of life

content: 4. (=侮る)to despise

content.content: 君は人をなめてかかるのが悪い
You ought not to hold people cheap.

〈他動〉
1. To lick; to lap

content.content: 犬が人の足をなめる
A dog licks your feet.
猫が牛乳をなめる
A cat laps up milk.
皿をなめる
to lick the dish clean
猛火は近隣をなめ尽した
The devouring element licked up the whole neighbourhood.
子どもをなめるように可愛がる
to dote on a child
始めは飴をなめさしておく
I give him line at first.
ちょいとなめたが身のつまり
A single taste of pleasure was my ruin.

content: 2. (=試味する)to taste

content.content: 汁をなめてみる(塩梅見る)
to taste the soup
