なや〔納屋〕
〈名〉A barn; an outhouse

content:
なやます〔悩ます〕
〈他動〉To harass; to gall; to annoy; to molest; to afflict; to trouble; to torment; to torture; to rack; to worry; to pester; to plague; to oppress; to persecute; to agonize; to nag; to give (one) anxiety

content.content: 小口径の速射砲は敵を悩ますに用いる
The smaller quick-fires are used to harass the enemy.
我が隊は敵の砲火に悩まされた
We were harassed by a galling fire.
戦わずして敵を悩ます
to resort to Fabian policy
彼は病に悩まされている
He is afflicted with a disease.
僕は時々頭痛に悩まされる
I am troubled with frequent headaches.
終夜種々の心配に悩まされた
I was oppressed with doubts and anxieties―tormented with doubts and anxieties―all night.
心を悩ます
to worry (oneself)
人の心を悩ます
to wring one's heart
頭を悩ます
to rack one's brains―cudgel one's brains―worry (oneself)
彼は絶えず金策で頭を悩ましてる
He is constantly worrying―worried―about the means of raising money.
苦労は心を悩ます
Care preys on the mind.
神経を悩ます
to try one's nerves
こちらの攻撃が彼の胸を悩ましているに違いない
Our shaft must be rankling in his breast.
圧制に悩まされる国民などは世界中に無くなる
No people in the world will be galled by oppression.
怨霊に悩まされる
to be haunted by the furies of one's victim
(膏血を絞って)貧民を悩ます
to grind down the poor―grind the faces of the poor―put the screw on the poor―put the poor under the screw
彼は意地の悪い質問をして先生を悩まして悦んでいる
He takes a malicious pleasure in plaguing his teacher with hard questions―pestering him with hard questions.
あの山に住む山賊が近郷を悩ましている
Some bandits who have their stronghold in that mountain are the terror of the country.
宸襟{しんきん}を悩まし奉る
to cause the Emperor anxiety

content:
なやみ〔悩み〕
〈名〉Affliction; agony; anguish; worry; trouble

content.content: 生きて居ると悩みが絶えぬ
Life is subject to constant troubles.
生活の悩み
the troubles of life―the worries of life
心の悩み
mental anguish
心の悩みに堪えかねて声を揚げた
I cried out in anguish of heart.
恋の悩み
the sorrows of love

content:
なやむ〔悩む〕
〈自動〉To suffer (from a disease); to be afflicted (with a disease); to be troubled (with a headache); to be tormented (with anxiety); to be oppressed (with doubts); to be harassed (by anxieties); to be galled (by oppression); to be worried (by cares, etc.)

content.content: 彼は病に悩んでいる
He is suffering from a disease―afflicted with a disease.
久しく肺病に悩んでいる
He has long been suffering from consumption―afflicted with consumption―a martyr to consumption.
僕は時々頭痛に悩む
I am troubled with frequent headaches.
一家は憂いに悩んでいる
The family are oppressed with doubts and anxieties―tormented with doubts and anxieties―harassed by doubts and anxieties.
生活難に悩んでいる者が多い
Many people are harassed by the high cost of living―There is much misery among the people.
細君は家事の苦労に悩んでいるらしい
His wife seems to be worried by household cares.
圧制に悩むような国民は世界中に無くなる
No people in the world will groan under oppression―be galled by oppression.
恋に悩める娘
a lovesick maiden
雨に悩める海棠
flowers drooping in the rain―(美人の意味なら)―a beauty bedewed with tears

content:
なら
〈接続詞〉If; in case; provided; suppose; supposing; on condition that

content.content: 鳥ならば飛んでも行くが
If I were a bird, I would fly to you.
何事かあったなら僕が責任を負う
In case anything should happen, I will answer for the consequences.
謝まるならゆるしてやる
I will pardon him provided he acknowledge his fault.
もしそうとしたならどうなるか
Suppose it were so―Supposing it were so―what would happen?
酒を止めるなら使ってやる
I will employ you on condition that you give up drinking［注意］この意味を条件法の助動詞をもって表わすことがある。
僕ならそんなことをせぬ
I would not do so.
日本人なら死ぬ
A Japanese would die.
僕でお役に立つなら幸いです
I should be happy to be of service to you.
国家の為なら死ぬ
I would die for my country.
晩なら来られたのだ
I could have come in the evening.

content: 〈副〉(=成ろうことなら)if possible; for preference

content.content: ならば今日中に仕上げて貰いたい
I want to have it finished, if possible, in the course of the day.
ならば英国人が好い
I should like an Englishmen for preference.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. For; as for

content.content: 文章なら申し分が無い
As for the style, it leaves nothing to be desired.
風景なら日本に越す国は無い
For scenery, there is no country like Japan.
風邪ならば葛根湯
For colds, there is nothing like Kakkonto.
太刀ならば日本刀
For swords, there is none like the Japanese.
そのことなら僕だって赤ん坊だ
For that matter, I am a baby myself.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 主が主なら従も従
As is the master, so in the servant―Like master, like man.
明日天気なら行く
I will go tomorrow, weather permitting.
これならばという人が無い
I can not find a man that will do―a man after my heart.
けんかなら持って来い
I am ready for a quarrel.
住まうなら東京
Tokyo is the only place worth living in.
あなたのことなら
I can refuse you nothing.

なら〔楢〕
〈名〉A kind of oak (used for fuel)

content:
ならい〔習い〕
〈名〉
1. (=習慣)a habit; a custom; a usage

content.content: 習い性となる
Habit is second nature.

content: 2. (=常習)the way (of the world); the lot (of man)

content.content: それが浮世の習いだ
That is the way of the world.
苦労は世の習い
Troubles are the lot of man.
満つれば欠くる世の習い
“Every flow has its ebb”
逢うて別れは浮世の習い
Those who meet must part―“The best of friends must part.”
哀別離苦は世の習い
We are liable to separations in this world.

content:
ならう〔習う〕
〈他動〉To learn (English); to study (mathematics); to practise (music); to take lessons in (singing); to be trained to (some trade)

content.content: 英語を習う
to learn English―study English
西洋人について英語を習いました
I studied English under a foreigner―A foreigner taught me English.
誰について漢学を習ったか
Under whom did you learn Chinese literature?―Who taught you Chinese literature?
この本を誰に習ったか
With whom did you read this book?
音楽を習う
to practise music―(師匠をとってなら)―take lessons in music
娘どもは茶や花を習う
Girls take lessons in tea-ceremony and flower-arrangement.
書を習う
to practise penmanship
三年間柔術を習いました
I took lessons in jujutsu for three years.
お前は何か商売を習ったか
Have you been trained to any trade?
君は二三度習えば覚えられる
You can learn it in a few lessons.
習うは一生
We learn while we live―“Live and learn”
習うより慣れろ
“Example is better than precept”―“Practice makes perfect”
門前の小僧習わぬ経を読む
“The sparrows near a school sing the primer”

content:
ならう〔倣う〕
〈他動〉
1. To imitate (a person); to follow (one's example); to emulate (a hero); to copy from (nature); to copy after (a model); to model after (a pattern); to pattern after (a model); to take pattern by (Confucius); to follow suit; to follow in one's wake; to tread in one's footsteps; to walk in one's shoes; to take a leaf out of one's book

content.content: 手本に倣う
to follow an example―copy after a model―model after a pattern―pattern after a model―take pattern by a model
人の例に倣う
to follow one's example―follow suit―follow in one's wake―tread in one's footsteps―walk in one's shoes―take a leaf out of one's book
先例に倣う
to follow a precedent
雛形に倣う
to write after the model
西洋ふうに倣う
to imitate foreign manners
日本の海軍は英国の海軍に倣って起こしたものだ
The Japanese navy was modelled after the English.
日本の園芸は自然に倣ったものだ
Japanese gardening is copied from nature.
五年級が同盟休校をやると後はこれに倣った
When the Fifth Year went on strike, the rest followed suit.
僕は親の行動に倣います
I shall follow in my father's footsteps.
ロシア人は日本に倣って初瀬艦を沈めた
The Russians took a leaf out of Japan's book, and sank the Hatsuse.
皆彼に倣う
Everybody imitates him―Everybody follows his example.
彼は学生の倣うべき手本だ
He is an example for students to emulate.
何に倣って
in imitation of―after―something
僕は Macaulay に倣って文を学んだ
I formed my style after Macaulay―after the model of Macaulay―on the model of Macaulay.
Macaulay に倣って文を書く人が多い
Many people write in imitation of Macaulay―after the manner of Macaulay―? la Macaulay.
これに倣って上衣をこしらえてくれ
Make a coat after this―after this model―on this model.
手本に倣って手習いする
to practise penmanship after a model
自然に倣って花を生ける
to arrange flowers by the light of nature
以下これに倣う
The rest to follow this example.

content: 2. ［軍事］(=列を整える)to dress

content.content: 倣え
Dress up!
右に倣え
Right dress!―Eyes right!

content:
ならえ〔倣え〕
〈号令〉
1. Dress up!

content.content: 右に倣え
Right dress―Eyes right!
以下之に倣え
The rest to follow this example.

content:
ならく〔奈落〕
〈名〉
1. Hell; the bottomless pit

content.content: 奈落の底
the abyss―the abysm
奈落の底へ落ちる
to fall into the bottomless pit

content: 2. (=芝居の奈落)the mezzanine

content.content: 奈落の口
the trap

content:
ならし〔均し〕
〈副〉On an average; on a par

content.content: 生徒の数は月によって違うが均し五千だ
The students number 5,000 on an average―The students average 5,000 in number.

content:
ならす〔慣らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=習慣をつける)to habituate (one to danger); to accustom (one to some work); to inure (one to hardships); to harden (one to crime); to season (one to the climate)

content.content: 彼を授業に慣らすと使える
If he is accustomed to class-work, he will prove useful.
軍人は艱難に慣らされている
Soldiers are inured to hardships.
危険にも慣らされている
They are also habituated to dangers.
彼は悪事に慣らされて人を殺すくらいは平気だ
He is hardened to crime.
身体を気候に慣らす
to season oneself to the climate
風土に慣らす
to acclimate a man―acclimatize an animal or a plant

content: 2. (=訓練する)to train (a boy to some trade); to practise (a student in English); to drill (a student in English); to exercise (troops)

content.content: 猟犬をならす
to train―enter―a pointer or a setter
芸をするように犬をならす
to teach a dog tricks

content:
ならす〔均す〕
〈他動〉To level, smoothe, roll (the ground)

content.content: 地を均らす
to level the ground―smoothe the ground
Roller で地を均す
to roll the ground

content:
ならす〔馴らす〕
〈他動〉To tame (a wild beast); to domesticate (a wild animal); to subdue (a wild nature)

content.content: 野獣をならす
to tame a wild beast―domesticate a wild animal
人間のならした動物はいくつあるか
How many animals has man domesticated?
猿はよくならしてある
The monkeys are well tamed.
山男をならしたら使えるかも知れぬ
If you subdue the wild man, he may prove useful.
馬をならす
to break in a horse―break a horse to the rein―rough a horse―enter a horse
鷹をならす
to enter a hawk
蛇をならす
to charm a snake

content:
ならす〔鳴らす〕
〈他動〉
1. To ring (a bell); to clang (the alarm-bell); to sound (a trumpet); to jingle (coins); to clink (a glass); to clank (one's chains); to cluck (one's tongue); to crack (a whip or a finger); to clap (hands); to smack (one's lips); to blow (a whistle)

content.content: 鈴を鳴らして下さい
Please ring the bell!―press the button!
誰か鈴を鳴らしている
There is a ring at the bell.
鈴を鳴らして女中を呼ぶ
to ring for the servant
半鐘を鳴らす
to ring the alarm-bell―clang the alarm-bell
自動車が警笛を鳴らす
A motor-car sounds the honker―sounds the horn.
汽船が汽笛を鳴らす
A steamer blows the whistle.
手を鳴らす
to clap hands (to clap one's hands―拍手と区別す)
ご用の節はお手をお鳴らし下さい
Please clap hands when you want me.
馬を励ますために舌を鳴らす
to cluck one's tongue―cluck
鞭を鳴らす
to crack a whip
銭をザクザク鳴らす
to jingle coins in one's pocket
貨幣を鳴らしてみる
to ring a coin
コップを当てて鳴らす
to clink glasses together
喉を鳴らす
(豚なら)to grunt―(猫なら)―purr
不平を鳴らす
to complain―air one's grievances

content: 3. (=有名なり)to be famous

content.content: 若い時は鳴らしたものだ
She was a famous beauty in her day.

ならずもの〔ならず者〕
〈名〉A scamp; a reprobate

content:
ならでは
〈前置詞相当〉None but; nothing short of; but for:(副詞に訳せば) alone

content.content: ナポレオンならでは能{あた}わざりしならん
None but a Napoleon could have done it―A Napoleon alone could have done it.
奇跡ならでは助かるまじ
Nothing short of a miracle could save him―A miracle alone could save him.
女ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
But for woman, the world would be dark―Woman is the light of life.

content:
ならぬ
〈助動詞〉(何々してはならぬ) must not (do something):(何々しなければならぬ) must (do something); to have to (do something); to be obliged to (do something); to need (doing something)

content.content: この規則を破ってはならぬ
You must not break this rule.
人は働かねばならぬ
Man must work―Man has to work―Man is obliged to work.
この家は塗り換えねばならぬ
The house must be painted―needs painting―want painting.

content: ならば→『

content.content: なら

content:
ならび〔並び〕
〈名〉A row; a range; a line

content.content: 一並びの家
a row of houses
一並びの山
a range of mountains
本艦は本艦隊と同じ並びにおった
We were in line with the Main Squadron.
それはこの並びのはずれの家です
It is the last house on this side of the street.

content:
ならびしょうする〔並び称する〕
〈他動〉To couple (one name with another); to rank (one man with another); to class (one man with another)

content.content: 日本は列国と並び称せらるるに到れり
Japan now ranks with the Great Powers.
かかる人々と並び称せらるるを欲せず
I do not wish to have my name coupled with those of such men.

content:
ならびたつ〔並び立つ〕
〈自動〉To coexist (with something else)

content.content: 両雄並び立たず
A great man can not brook a rival.

ならびなき〔並び無き〕
〈形〉Peerless; matchless; unmatched; unequalled; unrivalled; unparallelled; incomparable; sans pareil

content:
ならびに〔並に〕
〈接続詞〉And:(打消に伴えば)or

content.content: 入学志願者は中学を卒業し並びに身体健全なるを要す
The applicant for entrance must have finished the middle school and be of sound heath.
館内にて談話並びに喫煙するを許さず
It is not allowed to talk or smoke in the hall.

content:
ならびゆく〔並び行く〕
〈自動〉To run parallel (with something)

content.content: 理論と実際とは並び行くべきものである
Practice should go hand in hand with theory.

content:
ならぶ〔並ぶ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=並列する)to be ranged; to be drawn up:(列と並ぶ) to range oneself (with a row):(二人並ぶ) to stand side by side:(誰と並ぶ) to stand side by side with (some one); to place oneself by the side of (another):(横に並ぶ) to stand abreast:(縦に長く並ぶ) to form a row; to stand in a row:(横に長く並ぶ) to form a line; to stand in a line:(何に沿って並ぶ) to line (the road, etc.)

content.content: 卒業生が正面に並んだ
The graduates were ranged in front.
諸候方が両側にずらりと並んだ
The Daimyos sat in a row on either side.
二人並んでいる
They stand side by side.
並んで坐る
to sit side by side
学校では彼と並んで坐る
I sit side by side with him―sit by his side―sit next him―in school.
並んで寝る
to lie side by side
女が男と並んで来た
A woman came side by side with a man.
並んで進む
to advance shoulder to shoulder
並んで戦う
to fight shoulder to shoulder
並んで歩く
to walk abreast
時世と並んで進む
to move abreast of the times
城壁は騎兵が五人並んで歩けるだけ厚い
The wall is so thick that, horsemen can ride five abreast on it.
一列に並ぶ
to form a row―stand in a row
二列に並ぶ
to form two lines―stand in two lines
三重に並んでいる
They are drawn up three deep.
生徒は学校の前に並んでいる
The students are drawn up―(一列になら)―drawn up in a line―(二列にも三列にもなら)―drawn up in lines―drawn up two or three deep―in front of the school
生徒が両側に並んだ
The students formed a lane.
学生が市街の両側に並んだ
The students lined the streets―The streets were lined with students.
あの町は古着屋が並んでいる
The street is lined with old-clothes shops.
イタリアは同盟軍側に並んだ
Italy ranged herself on the side of the Allies.
並んで写真を取る
to be photographed in a group

content: 2. (=肩を並べる、匹敵する)to rank with, range with, cope with, vie with, equal, rival (one)

content.content: 日本は列国と並ぶようになった
Japan now ranks with―takes rank with―the Great Powers.
彼は三井岩崎と並ぶ身代になった
He now vies with―copes with―the Mitsuis and Iwasakis in wealth.
英語では彼に並ぶ者は無い
No man can compare with him in the knowledge of English―He stands unrivalled―stands unequalled―stands unchallenged―stands alone―in the knowledge of English.

content:
ならべたてる〔並べ立てる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ならべる〔並べる〕

content:
ならべる〔並べる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=配列する)to arrange (articles); to range (troops); to marshal (facts); to display (goods); to spread (dishes); to juxtapose (two things); to place (two things) side by side; to place (one thing) by the side of (another); to place (things) in a row; to place (things) in order

content.content: 二つ並べてみると比べものにならぬ
Place the two side by side, and there is no comparison between the two.
枕を並べて寝る
to lie down side by side
枕を並べて討死にする
to fall fighting side by side
日本語と英語を並べてみると面白い
It is interesting to place Japanese expressions by the side of English.
生徒を一列に並べる
to place the students in a row―form the students in line
本を順序を立てて並べる
to place the books in order
白と黒を一つおきに並べる
to place the white and black ones alternately
机が五列に並べてある
The desks are arranged in five rows.
彼の文章は綺麗な言葉を並べるだけだ
He only marshals pretty expressions in his writings.
品物を店に並べる
to display goods in the shop―put goods on show
欲しい物が店に並べてある
Tempting goods are on show in the shop.
ご馳走を並べる
to spread dishes on the table―spread the table with dishes
ご馳走を並べた食卓
a table spread with dainty dishes―a daintily spread table
山海の珍味が並べてある
There is a spread of delicacies on the table.
金持ちがお札を並べる
A rich man pays down the money―counts out the money.

content: 2. (=列挙する)to enumerate (one's virtues); to array (facts); to multiply (instances); to run through the catalogue of (the virtues, etc.)

content.content: 彼は先生の徳を並べる、欠点を並べる(並べ立てる)
He likes to enumerate his teacher's virtues―enumerate his teacher's faults.
彼は堂々と事実を並べて論じた
He argued with an imposing array of facts.
その理由を一々並べる必要は無い
I need not run through the catalogue of my reasons.
例を並べる(並べ立てる)
to multiply instances
文句を並べる
to multiply words
長文句を並べる
to speechify―sermonize―hold forth
彼はこの話が出ると長文句を並べる
He likes to expatiate―descant―enlarge―dilate―amplify―on the subject.
脅し文句(凄い文句)を並べる
to try to intimidate one with threats
紋切形の脅し文句を並べる
to array the stereotyped forms of threat
理屈を並べる
to array reasons―talk
いまさら理屈を並べたって始まらない
It is no use talking now.
苦情を並べる
to air one's grievances
ご託を並べる
to harp on the same string―ring the changes on the same subject
つまらなぬことを並べ立てる
to make an imposing array of trifles―give“a beggarly account of empty boxes”

content: 3. (=比べる)to place (one thing) by the side of (another)

content.content: 日本人はロシア人と並べると子どものようだ
A Japanese is a mere boy by the side of the Russian giant.
肩を並べる
to rank with―range with―cope with―vie with―compare with―rival―equal―any one
日本は列国と肩を並べるようになった
Japan now ranks with―takes rank with―the Great Powers.
彼は三井岩崎と肩を並べる身代になった
He now vies with―copes with―the Mitsuis and Iwasakis in wealth.
英語では彼と肩を並べる者は無い
No man can compare with him in the knowledge of English―He stands unrivalled―stands unequalled―stands unchallenged―stands alone―in the knowledge of English.

content:
ならわし〔習わし〕
〈名〉A custom; a habit; a usage; a practice; convention

content.content: ここでは盆暮には贈答品をやり取りする習わしです
It is the custom with us―customary in our country―to exchange presents at the Bon festival and the end of the year.
その国では賄賂を使う習わしだ
Bribery is a common practice in that country.

content:
なり
〈接続詞〉
1. As soon as:(前置詞に訳せば) immediately on (doing something)

content.content: 彼は朝起きるなり水をかぶる
He takes a cold douche as soon as he gets up―immediately on rising.

content: 2. (Either...) or...

content.content: 去るなりとどまるなり勝手にし給え
You may go or stay as you please.

content: 〈副〉(あれなり、それなり) as it is

content.content: 話はあれなりになっている
The matter remains as it was.

content:
なり〔形〕
〈名〉
1. (=形状)a shape

content.content: 卵なりの顔
an egg-shaped face―an oval face
なりが大きい
to be tall
年にしてはなりが大きい
He is tall for his age―a tall boy of his age.
なりは大きいけれどもまだほんの子どもです
Though he is so tall, he is a mere child.
なりが小さい
to be short of stature
みなり〔身形〕
なりで脅かす
to dazzle people by dress
このなりでは人前へ出られぬ
I am not fit to be seen―unpresentable.
彼はなりふりにかまわぬ
He is careless about his appearance.

content:
なり〔鳴り〕
〈名〉
1. Ring

content.content: 金貨は鳴りが好い
A gold coin rings true―It has a true ring.
鳴りが悪い
It rings false―It has a false ring.
鳴りを静める
to hush
満堂鳴りを静めた
The hall was hushed.
彼が立つと皆鳴りを静めて謹聴する
When he rises to speak, everybody listen to him with hushed attention.
人が僕のことを話していたから鳴りを静めて聴いた
When I found that they were talking about me, I was all ears.

content:
なりあがり〔成上り〕
〈名〉An upstart; a parvenu; a mushroom; a self-made man

content.content: 世間では彼は成り上がりだと言って見下げている
People look down upon him as an upstart.
彼は教育の無い成り上がり者だ
He is a self-made man.

content:
なりあがりもの〔成上り者〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: なりあがり〔成上り〕

content:
なりあがる〔成上がる〕
〈自動〉To rise (suddenly or unexpectedly) in the world; to rise to be (something)

content.content: 彼は一兵卒から大将までに成り上がった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.

content:
なりおと〔鳴音〕
〈名〉Ring

content.content: 金貨は鳴音が好い
A gold coin rings true―It has a true ring.
鳴音が悪い
It rings false―It has a false ring.

content:
なりかけ〔成りかけ〕
〈形〉About-to-be; incipient

content.content: 彼はおとなになりかけだ
He is about to be a man.
肺病になりかけだ
He is an incipient consumptive―developing consumptive symptoms.

content:
なりかわる〔成り代る〕
〈他動〉To take the place of (one); to supply the place of (one)

content.content: 姉が母になり代って弟を育てた
His sister supplied the place of his mother―His sister brought him up in place of his mother.
人の身になり代る
to put oneself in the place of others
まあ僕の身になり代って見給え
Put yourself in my place!

content:
なりきん〔成金〕
〈名〉
1. (=将棋の成金) a passed pawn; a promoted man
2. (=俄{にわか}分限)an overnight millionaire; an upstart (millionaire); a parvenu (millionaire); a nouveau riche

content.content: 彼は成金ぶりを遺憾無く発揮している
He plays the upstart millionaire to the full.
戦争成金
a war millionaire
船成金
a shipping millionaire

content:
なりさがる〔成り下がる〕
〈自動〉To come down in the world; to fall to (a low condition); to sink to (misery); to come to (do something mean); to be reduced to (beggary, etc.)

content.content: 彼は食客になり下がった
He is reduced to dependence―He has sunk to dependence.
彼は衣食のために筆を執るまでにもなり下がった
He has come to write for his bread.
まだ筆で食うほどにはなり下がらない
I have not fallen so low as to live by the pen.

content:
なりすます〔成り澄ます〕
〈自動〉To become (something grave, sober, solemn, staid, modest, demure, etc.)

content.content: 腕白小僧が真面目な先生になりすましている
The mischievous urchin has become a grave teacher.
お天婆娘がお母さんになりすましている
The romping girl has become a staid matron.
芸者が奥さんになりすましている
The woman of the town is now a fine lady.

content:
なりそこなる〔成り損う〕
〈自動〉To miss being (something); to come near (doing something)

content.content: 金持ちになり損なった
I just missed being a rich man―I might have been a rich man.
土左衛門になり損ったことがある
I once came near being drowned―I was once very nearly drowned.

なりたち〔成立ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=由来)the origin, the history (of an institution, etc.)
2. (=組織)the formation, the organization (of a society, etc.)
3. (=要素)the elements, the constituents (of a body, etc.)

content:
なりたつ〔成立つ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=何々よりなる)to consist of, be composed of, be formed of, be made up of (so many parts)

content.content: 人は肉体と霊魂より成り立つ
Man consists of body and soul.
本会は本校卒業生から成り立っている
The present association is composed of the graduates of the school.
日本は四大島より成り立つ
Japan is formed of four large islands.
一行は有志者から成り立っている
The party is made up of volunteers.

content: 2. (=成立する)(a project) materializes; (a reason) holds good; (an argument) holds water; (a society) is formed; (a company) is floated; (a matter) is settled; (a compromise) is effected; (a contract) is concluded; (a bill) is passed or carried; (a theory) is established; (a claim) is substantiated; (a statement) is made good;(a case) is made out; (an action) lies

content.content: 二人の間に妥協が成り立った
They have effected a compromise.
相談が成り立った
We have settled the matter―come to terms―come to an understanding.
契約が成り立った
The contract is concluded.
議案が大多数で成り立った
The bill was carried―The bill was passed―by a large majority.
予算が成り立たない
They could not carry the Budget.
動議が成り立たなかった
The motion was not passed.
そんな訴訟は成り立たない
Such an action will not lie.
そんな要求は成り立たない
You can not substantiate such a claim.
会社が成り立つかどうかわからぬ
We can't say whether the company can be floated or not.
そんな説は成り立たない
You can not make good your statement.
そんな学理は成り立たない
You can not establish such a theory.
そんな理由は成り立たない
Your reason does not hold good.
そんな議論は成り立たない
Your argument does not hold water.
法廷で弁護士の議論が立派に成り立った
He has made out a good case.
この計画を成り立たせるのは困難だ
It is difficult for this project to materialize.

content:
なりと
〈接続詞〉(以下の語に含まる) any (that); whoever; whatever; whichever; whenever; wherever

content.content: 誰なりとも連れて来い
Bring any one you like―whomever you like.
さあ何なりとご随意にお取りなさい
Help yourself to anything you like!―whatever you fancy!
どれなりとお気に入ったのをお選びなさい
Choose either you like!―Whichever you please!
どこへなりと行け
Go anywhere!―Go wherever you like!

content: 〈副〉Even

content.content: 写真なりとも見たい
I should like to see even a photograph of him.
ちょっとなりとも会いたい
I should like to see him even for a while.
ひと目なりと会いたい
I should like to catch a glimpse of him.

content: なりとも→『

content.content: なりと

content:
なりはてる〔成り果てる〕
〈自動〉To be fated, destined, doomed (to end one's days in misery); to be reduced to (poverty, etc.)

content.content: 彼は貧乏になり果てた
He is reduced to poverty.
不正な業に従事する者は末は乞食になり果てる
Those who live on the cross are reduced to beggary―doomed to die in a ditch.
彼は見る影も無くなり果てた
He is but the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was.

content:
なりひびく〔鳴り響く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: なりわたる〔鳴り渡る〕

content:
なりふり〔形振り〕
〈名〉Personal appearance

content.content: 彼はなりふりにかまわぬ
He is careless about his appearance―indifferent about his appearance.
働く時はなりふりにかまっていられない
One can not mind one's appearance when one is at work.
なりふりにかまわず
anyhow and everyhow
戦地ではなりふりにかまわず食事をする
Men at the front eat anyhow and everyhow.

なりもの〔生物〕
〈名〉Fruits; farm products

content:
なりもの〔鳴物〕
〈名〉A musical instrument

content.content: 鳴物停止
suspension of musical performances
鳴物入りで歌う
to sing to a musical accompanyment
彼の新任を鳴物入りで吹聴した
His appointment was announced with a flourish of trumpets.

content:
なりゆき〔成行〕
〈名〉The course (of nature); the turn (of affairs); the developments (of an affair); the consequences (of one's deed); the progress (of negotiations); the issue (of a war); the event (of a match); the destiny (of man, etc.)

content.content: 自然の成り行き
the course of nature
自然の成り行きに任せよ
Let nature take her course!
自然の成り行きに任せれば死んでしまう
He will die in the (ordinary) course of nature.
事の成り行き
the course of things―the turn of affairs―the developments of an affair
事の成り行きに任せよ
Leave the matter to take its own course!―Let things slide!
事の成り行きを見た上でいずれとも決めよう
Let us see the turn of affairs―see what turn affairs will take―see how affairs will turn out―before we decide.
将来の成り行きに任せよ
Let the future take care of itself!
成り行きを待つ
to await developments―await the issue of events―abide by the event
全力を尽しておいて成り行きを待つよりほかは無い
I can only do my best, and abide by the event.
君は勝手でしたことだから成り行きを待つよりほかは無い
As you did the thing of your own choice, you must take the consequences.
平和条件は戦争の成り行きによって決まる
The terms of peace will depend on the issue of the war.
返事は成り行き次第
My answer will depend on the issue of the affair―depend on the event of the affair.
世の成り行きは誰にもわからぬ
No man knows the destiny of the world.

content:
なりゆく〔成行く〕
〈自動〉To take its course; to take a turn; to turn out

content.content: どうか成り行くさ
Things will take their course.
事がどう成り行くか見た上で決めることにしよう
Let us see what turn things will take―how things will turn out―before we decide.
尋常に成り行けば死んでしまう
He will die in the ordinary course of nature.

なりわい〔生業〕
〈名〉Means of livelihood

content:
なりわたる〔鳴り渡る〕
〈自動〉To ring; to echo; to resound; to reverberate

content.content: 彼が笑うと家中に鳴り渡る
His laugh rings through the house―reverberates through the house―(は第一構文、第二構文は)―The whole house rings with his laugh―reverberates with his laugh
彼の雷名は全国に鳴り渡った
His name rang through the land―resounded through the land―(は第一構文、第二構文は)―The whole country rang with his fame―resounded with his fame
砲声は天までも鳴り渡った
The guns rent the heavens―(は第一構文、第二構文は)―The very heavens echoed with the cannonade

content:
なる〔成る〕
〈不完動詞〉
1. To become (rich); (will) be (a great man); to make oneself (a scholar); to make (a good officer); to form (a part); to grow (tall); to get (well); to turn (pale); to go (mad); to come (of age); to fall (ill or sick); to wear (thin or deeper)

content.content: 風説が事実となった
The rumour has become an accomplished fact.
嘘は癖になる
Lying becomes a habit.
彼とはどこで知巳になったか
Where did you become acquainted with him?―make his acquaintance?
上手になる
to become skilful―attain skill
彼は勉強で金持ちになった
He has become rich by industry―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Industry has made him rich
彼は政治家になった
He has become a politician―entered upon a political career.
軍人になった
He has become a soldier―entered upon a military career.
商人になった
He has become a merchant―entered upon a commercial career.
あんな人に校長になられては困る
It would be awkward to have him become our principal.
あの人は何になったか
What has become of him?
彼が死んだら遺族はどうなるか
If he should die, what would become of his family?［注意］未来に「成る」は“become”の代りに“be”を用いる。
俺は何の某と言われるようになってみせる
I will be somebody in the world.
来年は十五になります
I shall be fifteen next year―I shall attain my fifteenth year next year.
僕は二十歳になった
I am twenty―I have attained my twentieth year.
君は何になるつもりか
What are you going to be?
僕は軍人になりたい
I wish to be an officer―I aspire to military honours.
外交官になりたい
I wish to be a diplomat―I am an aspirant to diplomatic honours.
商人になりたい
I wish to be a merchant―I aspire to commercial honours.
鳥になりたい
I wish I were a bird.
いま一度若くなりたい
I wish I were young again.
僕が大臣になったら君を秘書官にしてやる
When I rise to be a minister, you shall be my secretary.
早く大きくなって偉くおなりなさい
You must grow up to be a great man.
僕はいつこんな本が読めるようになるだろうか
When shall I be able to read such books?［注意］「求めて成る」の意味には“make oneself”を用いる。
彼は刻苦勉励して学者になった
He made himself a scholar by close application.
あまり勉強すると病気になるぞ
If you work too hard, you will make yourself ill―(単文にすれば)―You will work yourself ill―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Overwork will make you ill［注意］「すれば成る」「成れる」の意味には“make”を用いる。
君はきっと好い軍人になります
I am sure you will make a good officer.
あの人は好い体格だ相撲にしたら好い相撲になる
He has a fine physique What a wrestler he will make!
親孝行な娘は夫を持つと貞女になる
A good daughter will make a good wife.
二と二を合わせりゃ四つになる
Two and two make four.［注意］「為す」(make)を「成る」(become)の他動詞構文に用いる。
ひと走り走ると温かになる
A run will make you warm.
こうなったのはあなたのお陰だ
You have made me what I am.［注意］特別の場合に用いる特別の語あり。
暗くなる
It grows dark―It is getting dark.
もう暗くなった
It is dark now.
暗くならないうちに着けるか
Can we arrive before dark?
暗くなってから着いた
We arrived after dark.
明るくなる
It grows light.
もう明るくなった
It is daylight now.
温かになる
It is getting warmer.
寒くなった
It is getting colder―Cold weather has set in.
晩になった
Evening has set in.
入梅になった
The rainy season has set in.
日が長くなる
The days are getting longer.
日が短くなる
The days are getting shorter.
病気になる
to get ill―fall ill―(は英、米は)―get sick―fall sick
君の病気はじきによくなる
You will soon get well.
英語が面白くなってきた
I am getting interested in English.
傘無しでずぶ濡れになった
I had no umbrella with me, and got wet to the skin.
彼は狼の餌食になった
He fell a prey to the wolves―became the prey of the wolves.
刺客の犠牲になった
He fell a victim to an assassin―became the victim of an assassin.
気違いになる
to go mad
彼は悔しがって気違いになった
He went mad with vexation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Vexation drove him mad
跛になる
to go lame―fall lame
盲になる
to go blind
丁年になる
to come of age―attain one's majority
彼は驚いて青くなった
He turned pale in alarm.
彼は頭が白くなった
His hair has turned gray.
赤くなる、黒くなる
to turn red―turn black
牛乳が酸っぱくなる
Milk turns sour.
彼は我らの謀叛人になった
He has turned traitor to our party.
仏教信者が耶蘇教信者になったのも一種の謀叛
The Buddhist has turned Christian.
彼は立派な地位を棒に振って新聞記者になった(のも一種の謀叛)
He has thrown up a good position, and turned journalist.
道楽者が聖人になった(のも一種の謀叛)
He has turned saint.
国民はおのおの国家の一要素となっている
Each citizen forms part of the state.
深くなる
(河なら)The channel wears deeper―(情人なら)―They fall more deeply in love with each other

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 坊主になる
to take the tonsure
坊主になってお詫びする
I will do penance in sackcloth and ashes.
尼になる
(西洋では) to take the veil―(日本では)―take the tonsure
議長になる
to take the chair
昨晩は誰が議長になったか
Who was in the chair last evening?
議員となる
to go into parliament
弁護士になる
to go to the bar
船乗りになる
to go to sea
俳優になる、女優になる
to go on the stage―take to the stage
追いはぎになる
to take to the road
飛行家になる
to take to the air
俺の部下になれ
Place yourself under my orders!
けんかなら俺が相手になってやる
If any one wants a quarrel, I am his man.
あんな者の相手にはならぬ
I will have nothing to do with such a man.
俺が仲人になろう
I will act as go-between.
お婆さんは綺麗な若い人の引立役になる
An old woman will serve as a foil to pretty young ladies.
競争は勉強の刺激となる
Emulation acts as an incentive to study.
試験は勉強の刺激になる
Examinations give an impetus to study.
アルコールは毒消しになる
Alcohol acts as an antidote.
リスリンは消毒になる
Glycerine acts as a disinfectant.
君は近眼だから船乗りにはなれぬ
As you are near-sighted, you won't do for a sailor.
この箱は食卓になる
This box will do for a table―serve for a table.
この本は枕になる
This book will do for a pillow―serve for a pillow.
力になってくれ給え
You will stand my friend.
困った時はお互いに力になろう
Let us stand by each other in time of need!
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
こんなことになろうとは夢にも思わなかった
I little dreamed that things would come to this.
そうすればどうなるか
Then what will happen?
選挙はどうなったか
How has the election gone?
末はどうなることやら
How will it all end?
いくら気をもんでもなるようにしかならぬ
Fret as you may, things will take their own course.
この仕事は金になる
There is money in it.
この品は金になる
This article will fetch money.
働くと金になる
Work will bring you money―You can earn money.
すぐ金になる仕事がしたい
I want to do something that can be turned to immediate account.
少なくとも百円にはなるつもりだ
I count on getting at least a hundred yen for it.
僕の身になってみ給え
Put yourself in my place!
雨になった
It has begun raining.
風になった
It has begun blowing.
暴風雨になりそうだ
There are signs of a storm.
暴風雨になった
A storm has come on.
戦争になりましょうか
Will there be a war?
この景色は絵になる
The view is picturesque.
この事件は訴訟になる
The case is actionable.
彼は二十歳になるかならずだ
He is scarcely twenty―hardly twenty.
十代で結婚する者は少なくなった
Few people now marry in their teens.
海外へ行く者が多くなった
Many people now go abroad.
たいがいの病は黴菌の作用だとなった
Most diseases are now referred to the action of bacilli.
(ひどく咳などして)僕は時々こうなる
I am often taken in this way.
後はどうなろうとかまわん(後は野となれ山となれ)
It may go to the devil for all I care.

content: 2. (=その後どうなる)to be left; to find oneself

content.content: 親父が死んで家が貧乏になった
Father dying, left us poor.
孤児になるのは両親が死んだためだから
to be left an orphan
彼は幼にして孤児になった
He was early left an orphan.
彼女は十五で後家になった
She found herself a widow at fifteen.

content: 3. (=何々するようになる)to come to (do something); to get to (do something); to grow to (do something); to learn to (do something); to begin to (do something)

content.content: 支那は日本を良友と思うようになった
China has come to regard Japan as her friend.
彼は衣食のために筆を執るようになった
He has come to write for his bread.
僕はどうしても数学が好きになれぬ
I can not get to like mathematics.
君はあの人と付き合ってみたらきっと好きになる
If you know him better, I am sure you will grow to like him.
(連れ添っているうちには)可愛くなる
You will learn to love him.
英語がだんだんわかるようになってきた
I begin to understand English better.
どうしてこうなったのか
How came it to be so?
君はどうして彼と親しくなったか
How came you to be so intimate with him?

content: 4. (=何々でなくなる、何々しなくなる)to cease to (be or do something)

content.content: 日本の勝利は珍しくなくなった
Japanese victories have ceased to be novel.
何でも珍しくなくなると人は驚かなくなる
When anything ceases to be novel, people will cease to wonder.
あの人はどもらなくなった
He has ceased to stammer.
あの人は近頃来なくなった
He has ceased to come of late.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 宗教を信ずると死ぬのが怖くなくなる
Religion disarms death of its terrors.
ボロを隠そうとしなければ貧乏も辛くなくなる
Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sting.

content: 5. (=変じてどうなる)to change into (ice); to turn into (steam); to grow into (a man); to pass into (yellow and red); to sink into (insignificance); to bud into (a woman); to ripen into (a matron); to develop into (a chicken); to degenerate into (weeds); to be transformed into (a butterfly); to unite into (one); to divide into(two); to break up into (many); to resolve itself into (something else)

content.content: 少年がおとなになる
A boy grows into a man.
どんぐりが樫の木になる
An acorn grows into an oak-tree.
水が氷にもなれば蒸気にもなる
Water changes into ice and steam―turns into ice and steam.
(楓の)緑がだんだんと赤になる
Green gradually passes into red.
女になりかけた娘
The girl is budding into a woman.
卵が発育して雛になる
An egg develops into a chicken.
草花は培養しないと雑草になる
Flowers, if left uncultivated, degenerate into weeds.
毛虫が蝶々になる
A caterpillar is transformed into a caterpillar.
もと偉かった人がつまらなくなった
The once great man has sunk into insignificance.
十三州連合して一共和国となる
The thirteen colonies united into a republic.
道が分かれて二又になる
A road divides into two branches―bifurcates.
ローマ帝国瓦解して欧州諸邦となった
The Roman Empire broke up into the European states.
彼の病気は好い方になった
His illness has changed for the better―taken a turn for the better―taken a favourable turn.
形勢が悪くなった
The state of affairs has changed for the worse―taken a turn for the worse―taken an unfavourable turn.
全院が委員となる
The whole house resolves itself into a committee.
この問題は帰するところこうなる
The question resolves itself into this:―

content: 6. (=成り上がる、成り下がる)to rise to be (a minister); to grow to (a great size); to sink to (dependence); to be reduced to (poverty)

content.content: 俺が大臣になったらお前を秘書官にしてやる
If I rise to be a minister, you shall be my secretary.
彼は一兵卒より身を起こして大将になった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.
鰻は大きくなる
The eel grows to a great size.
棕櫚はたいそう高くなる木だ
The palm-tree grows to a great height.
風が暴風になった
The wind has grown to a gale.
彼は食客になった
He has sunk to dependence―He is reduced to dependence.
貧乏になった
He is reduced to poverty.
乞食になった
He is reduced to beggary.
全市灰になってしまった
The whole city is reduced to ashes.
彼は骨と皮ばかりになってしまった
He is reduced to skin and bones―reduced to a skeleton.
船は砕けて粉々になってしまった
The ship was dashed to pieces.

content: 7. (=結果どうなる)to prove (true); to turn out (false); to come out (true); to come (true); to result in (a war); to end in (a failure); to terminate in (a failure); to issue in (some result); to culminate in (madness, etc.)

content.content: 最後に受けた傷が致命傷となった
The last wound he received proved mortal.
問い合わした結果風説が事実無根となった
On enquiry, the rumour turned out to be unfounded.
この取引はご利益になります
The transaction will turn out to your advantage.
夢が正夢になった
My dream has come true.
競争の結果戦争になった
The rivalry resulted in a war.
相撲が引き分けになった
The match ended in a draw.
訴訟が示談になった
The lawsuit ended in a compromise.
争いが妥協になった
The disputed ended in a compromise―terminated in a compromise.
彼の神経興奮が極度に達して全くの発狂になった
His nervous excitement culminated in sheer madness.

content: 8. (=〆ていくらになる)to amount to (so much); to come to (so much); to foot up to (so much); to run up to (so much); to mount up to (so much); to make (it so much)

content.content: しめていくらになるか
What do you make the total?―What do you make it?
しめて百円になる
The total amounts to 100 yen―comes to 100 yen―foots up to 100 yen―I make it 100 yen.
入費は大金になる
The expenses foot up to a great sum―run up to a great sum―mount up to a great sum.
塵積って山となる
Dust amassed will make a mountain―“Many a pickle makes a mickle”

content: 9. (=代ってなる)to give place to (anything)

content.content: ランプが電灯になった
The oil-lamp has given place to the electric light―The electric light has taken the place of the oil-lamp.
今に蒸気が電気になる
Steam will soon give place to electricity―Electricity will soon take the place of steam.
夜が昼になる
Night gives place to day―Day takes the place of night.

content: 10. (=時になる)(The time) comes

content.content: 春になった
Spring has come―Spring is here.
春になると花が咲く
The cherry-tree blossoms in spring.
早くその時になればよい
How I long for that time to come!
晩になった
Evening has set in.
入梅になる
The rainy season sets in.

content: 11. (=何々してから何年になる)It is (so many years since it happened)

content.content: 親父が死んでから三年になる
It is three years since my father died.
議会が開けてから二十年以上になる
It is over twenty years since the Diet was opened.
君が英語を始めてから何年になるか
How long is it since you began English?
今一カ月で満一年になる
Another month will make a full year.
この木は三百年になる
This tree is three hundred years old.
この家は百年になる
This house has stood for a century.

content: 12. (=何役を演ずる)to act the part of (Benkei); to appear as (Enya Hangan)

content.content: 吉右衛門が定九郎になった
Kichiemon appeared as Sadakuro

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=成就する)(an attempt) succeeds; (one's object) is attained; (one's purpose) is accomplished; (works) are completed; (anything) is done

content.content: 事が成る
An attempt succeeds―One succeeds in one's attempt―One attains one's object―One accomplishes one's purpose.
一事成れば万事成る
Nothing succeeds like success.
工事が成る、土木成る
The works are completed.
業が成る
One completes one's studies.
事は成るの日に成るにあらず
Things are not done when they are done.
成らぬうちが楽しみ
The pleasure lies in the pursuit.
少年老い易く学成り難し
“Art is long, and life is short”

content: 2. (=成立つ)to consist of, be composed of, be formed of, be made up of (so many parts)

content.content: 人は肉体と霊魂よりなる
Man consists of body and soul.
本会は本校の卒業生よりなる
The present association is composed of the graduates of the school.
日本は四大島よりなる
Japan is formed of four large islands.
一行は有志者よりなる
The party is made up of volunteers.
この詩はなっている
This poem is something like.
あの人の英語がなっている
His English is something like.
この作文はなっておらぬ
This composition is a failure.
この絵はまるでなっておらぬ
This picture is a dead failure.
この詩はカラなっておらん
The poem is sorry stuff―wretched stuff.

content:
なる〔生る〕
〈自動〉(木を主にすれば) to bear (fruit); to fruit:(実を主にすれば) to grow (on a tree)

content.content: 木に実が生る
Trees bear fruit.
木に実が生っている
There is fruit on the tree.
木に実がたくさん生っている
The tree is laden with fruit.
実がたくさん生って枝が垂れている
The branches are weighed down with fruit.
この木はよく実が生る木だ
This tree bears well―This tree is a good fruiter.
この梨の木は来年は生る
This pear-tree will bear next year.
梨の木に梨が生っている
There are pears on the tree.
木にまだ生っている
There are more on the tree.
若い木の根を切って実を生らせる
A young tree is made to fruit by cutting its roots.
バナナは鈴生りに生る
Bananas grow in clusters.
辛抱する木に金が生る
Wealth flows from industry.

content:
なる〔鳴る〕
〈自動〉
1. (A bell) rings; (a trumpet) sounds; (thunder) rolls; (a gun) roars; (a cannon) booms; (a clock) strikes

content.content: 鐘が鳴る
A bell rings.
鐘がジャンと鳴る
A bell clangs.
暮れの鐘がゴーンと鳴る
The evening bell tolls.
あれ鐘が鳴る
There goes the bell!
鈴{りん}が鳴る
A bell rings―There is a right at the bell.
鈴がチリンチリンと鳴る
A bell tinkles.
拍子木が鳴る
Clappers are clapped―There is a clapping of clappers.
鉄砲が鳴る
There is a report of a gun.
大砲が鳴る
A gun roars―(遠方でなら)―A gun booms
今ドンが鳴った
The gun was fired just now.
ズドンと大砲が鳴った
Bang! went the gun.
ラッパが鳴る
A bugle sounds.
今鳴るラッパは八時半
There goes bugle half past eight!
雷が鳴る
It thunders.
雷がゴロゴロ鳴る
Thunder rolls―(遠方でなら)―Distant thunder rumbles
今強い雷が鳴った
There was a peal of thunder―a thunderclap―just now.
雷は鳴る時ばかり様を付け
“Danger past, God for gotten”
時計が今鳴った
The clock struck just now.
時計がカチカチ鳴る
A clock ticks―A watch ticks.
時計の蓋がカチリと鳴る
The cover of a watch shuts with a click.
耳が鳴る
My ears ring―My ears sing―I have a ringing in my ears―a singing in my ears.
耳がガンガン鳴る
My ears throb―I have a throbbing in my ears.
腹が鳴る
My bowels rumble―I have a rumbling in my bowels.
山が鳴る
A mountain rumbles.
お手が鳴る
There is a handclap.
コップを当てるとチリンと鳴る
Glasses clink.
車がガラガラ鳴る
Wheels rattle.
窓がガタガタ鳴る
Windows rattle.
剣撃がガチャンと鳴る
Swords clash―Swords clang.
皿などがガチャガチャ鳴る
Dishes clatter
鎖がザクリザクリと鳴る
Chains clank.
靴がギューギュー鳴る
Shoes creak.
下駄がカラコロと鳴る
Clogs clatter.
弓がブーンと鳴る
A bow twangs.
腕が鳴る
One burns―itches―to do something.

content: 3. (=轟く)to ring; to resound

content.content: 雷名全国に鳴る
His name rings through the land―resounds through the land―(は第一構文、第二構文は)―The whole country rings with his name―resounds with his name

content: 4. (=有名なり)to be noted, famous, famed, renowned, celebrated (for anything)

content.content: 日本人は勇敢をもって鳴る
The Japanese are renowned for their bravery.
彼の学問は世界に鳴っている
He enjoys a world-wide fame as a scholar.

なるこ〔鳴子〕
〈名〉A clapper; a bird-clapper

content:
なるたけ〔成るたけ〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なるべく〔成る可く〕

なると〔鳴門〕
〈名〉A whirlpool; a maelstrom

content:
なるならば〔成るならば〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: なるべくなら〔成る可くなら〕

content:
なるべく〔成る可く〕
〈副〉
1. As (much) as possible; as (much) as one can:(形容詞に用いれば) all possible; the most possible

content.content: なるべく早く来い
Come as soon as possible―as early as you can.
なるべく早く仕事をしまって下さい
Please finish the work as early as possible―at your earliest convenience.
なるべく早く返事をして下さい
Give me the earliest possible answer!
なるべく急いで下さい
Make all possible haste!
なるべく急いで帰れ
Make all possible haste home!―Make the best of your way home!
この家をなるべく好い値に売って下さい
Please sell the home at the best possible price.
なるべく朝起き致します
I will rise as early as I can.
なるべく気をつけて
Be as careful as you can!―Use the greatest possible care!
なるべく運動なさい
Take as much exercise as you can!―Take the most possible exercise!
なるべくやってみよう
I will do all I can―I will do my best―I will do my utmost.
なるべく来るようにしよう
I will try my best to come.
こんな機会はめったに無いからなるべく利用すべしだ
Make the most of the rare opportunity!

content: 2. (=打消に伴えば)as little as one can; no more than one can help

content.content: 彼はなるべくものを言わぬ
He speaks as little as he can―speaks no more than he can help.
なるべく借金するな
Borrow no more money than you can help!
なるべくご面倒をかけません
I will give you no more trouble than I can help.
なるべくぜいたくをするな
Do with as few luxuries as you can!―Use no more luxuries than you can help!

content:
なるべくなら〔成る可くなら〕
〈副〉If possible; if one can:(打消に伴えば) if one can help it

content.content: なるべくなら今日中に帰れ
Be back in the course of the day if possible!
なるべくならそうして下さい
Do so if you can!
なるべくなら金を借りるな
Borrow no money if you can help it!
なるべくならものを言うな
Do not speak if you can help it!

content:
なるほど〔成程〕
〈応答詞〉I see; I perceive
〈副〉
1. Indeed; sure enough; I admit (the fact); I acknowledge (my fault); it is quite natural it is no wonder (that it should be so.)

content.content: (君が言う通り)なるほどそうだ
So, indeed, it is.
なるほど立派なものだ
It is, indeed, splendid.
なるほど君がそう言うのももっともだ
Indeed, you may well say that.
なるほど君の言う通りだ
I admit the truth of your statement.
なるほどそうだ
I admit the fact.
なるほど僕が悪かった
I acknowledge my fault.
なるほど彼は偉い
I acknowledge his greatness.
なるほど君の方が僕より偉い
I acknowledge your superiority.
(君が言う通り)なるほど居る
Sure enough, there he is.
なるほど君がそう思うのももっともだ
You may well think so―You have good reason to think so―It is quite natural that you should think so.
なるほど彼は成功するわけだ
It is quite natural that he should succeed―It is no wonder that he should succeed.
それではなるほど来られないわけだ
It is no wonder that he should be unable to come.
ははーなるほどと頷くだろう
You will have to admit the fact.
なるほどと頷いた
I admitted the fact in silence.
読んでみるとなるほどと頷かれることがたくさんあった
On reading it, I found many statements, of which I had to admit the truth.
その証拠を見るとなるほどと頷かれた
The proof was convincing.

content: 2. (=なるほどそうだがしかし)indeed, it is true, certainly, to be sure, no doubt (... but...)

content.content: なるほど年はとっているがしかしまだ丈夫だ
Indeed he is old, but he is still strong.
なるほどこの仕事は安いがしかし楽だから
It is true, the work is cheap, but it is light.
彼はなるほど学問はあるがしかし教師には向かない
He is certainly a good scholar, but he is not made for a teacher.
なるほど好い方法には違い無いがしかし実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but it is hard to practise.
なるほど善い本だがしかし大き過ぎる
It is, no doubt, a good book, but it is too large.
なるほど例外はある
There are, indeed, exceptions.
なるほど大したことじゃない
It is, indeed, a trifle.

content:
なれあい〔馴合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=共謀)collusion; conspiracy; confederacy

content.content: 二人はなれ合いで外人をだました
They conspired together to cheat the foreigner.
彼は会計官となれ合いで暴利を得た
He reaped enormous profits in collusion with the accountant.
彼らはなれ合いで互いの利益を図る
They play into each other's hands.
彼らは皆なれ合いだ
They are all conspirators―confederates―in league with each other.
なれ合いの仕事
a collusion―a collusion trick
なれ合いの勝負
a got-up match―a made-up match

content: 2. (=密通)improper connection; illicit intercourse; intrigue

content.content: なれ合い夫婦
an irregularly-united couple

content:
なれあう〔馴合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=共謀する)to collude, conspire, plot (with some one); to conspire together; to plot together

content.content: 二人はなれ合って外人をだました
They conspired together to cheat the foreigner.
彼は会計官となれ合って暴利を得た
He reaped enormous profits in collusion with the accountant.
二人はなれ合って互いの利益を図る
They play into each other's hands.
彼らは皆なれ合っている
They are all conspirators―confederates―in league with each other.
案内者が馬賊となれ合っていた
The guide was in league with the bandits.

content: 2. (=密通する)to have an improper connection with (a man or a woman); to hold an illicit intercourse with (a man or a woman); to intrigue with (a man or a woman)

なれそめる〔馴れ初める〕
〈他動〉To become a (courtesan's) habitu?

content:
なれど
〈接続詞〉→『

content.content: なれども

content:
なれども
〈接続詞〉Though; but

content.content: 事実なれども信じ難し
Though it is a fact, it is incredible―It is a fact, but it is incredible.

content:
なれなれしい〔馴々しい〕
〈形〉Familiar

content.content: 人とあまりなれなれしくするな
Don't be familiar with people!
彼はあまりなれなれしいから人に嫌われる
He is disliked, because he treats people with undue familiarity.
知らない男にいやになれなれしい言葉をかけられた
I was accosted by a stranger with a shocking familiarity.
あの男はなれなれしくない
He has an offish manner.

content:
なれのはて〔成れの果〕
〈名〉The ruin of one's former self; the wreck of what one was; the shadow of one's former self

content.content: 吾こそは佐野源左衛門の成れの果にて候
You behold in me the wreck of Sano Genzaemon.

content:
なれば
〈接続詞〉Since; seeing that; now that; as

content.content: さようおおせなれば信じます
Since you say so, I believe it.
彼は外人なれば投票権が無い
He can not vote, seeing that he is an alien.
相手が相手なれば泣き寝入りするよりほかは無い
As we have such a man to deal with, we must let the matter drop.

content:
なれる〔慣れる〕
〈自動〉To get used to (anything); to grow accustomed to (some work); to become habituated to (dangers); to become inured to (hardships); to become experienced in (teaching); to become practised in (teaching, etc.)

content.content: 新聞の攻撃くらいは慣れているから平気だ
I am quite used to newspaper attacks.
彼はまだ授業に慣れない
He is not yet accustomed to class-work―new to the work.
彼は授業に慣れている
He is experienced in teaching―practised in teaching―an old hand at teaching.
さすがは慣れたもんだ
He is an old hand at it.
軍人は艱難に慣れている
Soldiers are inured to hardships.
悪事に慣れると人殺しくらいは平気になる
One becomes hardened to crime.
暖国の気候に慣れるまでが骨だ
It takes long to become seasoned to a hot climate.
風土に慣れる
A man becomes acclimated―An animal or a plant becomes acclimatized.
船に慣れないと足がフラフラする
One not accustomed to the sea has unsteady legs.
船に慣れると足がフラつかない
One gets sea-legs on―gets one's sea-legs.
僕は船に慣れている
I am accustomed to the sea―I have sea-legs on.
僕はこの辺には慣れません
I am a stranger in these parts.
彼は商売に慣れない(新参だ)
He is new to the business.
慣れない商売は止した方が好い
You ought to think twice before engaging in a new business.
日本に慣れない西洋人だと見るとイカサマ物を授けてやる
When they have to do with a foreigner new to Japan, they foist questionable articles upon them.
彼は世の中に慣れている
He is used to the ways of the world―He is a man of the world.
彼は演説に慣れている
He is accustomed to speaking in public―at home on the platform.
あの女優は舞台に慣れない
She is not at home on the stage―new to the stage.
慣れた役人ならこれくらいの犯罪は黙許するのだ
An experienced official would connive at such offences.
経験家が無い時は慣れない先生を使わなければならない
Failing men of experience, we must employ inexperienced men―young hands.
どんな至難なことでも慣れればやさしくなる
The hardest things become easy by practice―by force of habit.
目に慣れた(見慣れた)光景だ
The sight is familiar to me―It is a familiar sight.
目に慣れない(見慣れない)光景だ
The sight is strange to me―new to me―It is a strange sight―a new sight.
耳に慣れた(聞き慣れた)声だ
The voice sounds familiar to me―It is a familiar voice.
耳に慣れない(聞き慣れない)声だ
The voice sounds strange to me―It is a strange voice.
習うより慣れろ
“Example is better than precept”―“Practice makes perfect”

content:
なれる〔熟れる〕
〈自動〉To mature, become matured; to season, become seasoned; to ripen, grow ripe

content.content: 味噌がなれる
Miso matures
温かい時は酒が早くなれる
Wine matures early in warm weather.
Brandy がなれるには十年も二十年もかかる
It takes ten or twenty years for brandy to season.
この牛肉はまだなれない
The beef is not yet ripe.

content:
なれる〔馴れる〕
〈自動〉To grow tame; to become domesticated; to become attached (to a man)

content.content: 人になれない動物がある
Some animals do not become domesticated.
猿はなれている
The monkey is tame.
この猿はまだなれない
This monkey is not yet tame―still wild.
熊は飼手になれている
The bear is attached to his keeper.
なれた動物
tame animals

content:
なれる〔狎れる〕
〈自動〉To become too familiar with (one's superiors); to despise (favours)

content.content: 生徒は先生になれて命令を聴かない
The boys are too familiar with their teacher to obey him.
彼らは恩恵になれて少しもありがたく思わぬ
They despise favours―scorn favours.

content:
なわ〔縄〕
〈名〉
1. A rope

content.content: 縄をなう
to twist a rope―make a rope
縄を張る
to stretch a rope―rope off a place
包みに縄をかける
to rope a bale
縄を引く
to pull the rope
縄をかけて引張る
to pull at the rope
この縄は持たぬ
The rope will not hold.
太い縄、小い縄
a large rope―a small rope
禍福は糾{あざなえ}る縄の如し
Life is a bundle of good and evil.

content: 2. (=縄目)bonds

content.content: 縄をかける
to put a prisoner in bonds―bind a criminal
縄にかける
to be bound―be put in bonds
神妙に縄にかかれ
Suffer yourself to be bound!
犯人はしかたがないと諦めたと見えて神妙にお縄を頂戴した
He seemed to accept the situation, and suffered himself to be bound.
縄を切る
to burst one's bonds
縄を脱ける
to slip one's bonds
彼は縄を脱けようとしてもがいた
He struggled to free himself from his bonds.
縄を解く
to unbind a prisoner―release a prisoner―set a prisoner at liberty
ひと筋縄でないかぬ奴だ
He is too old a bird to be caught with chaff.

content: 3. (=絞罪の縄)a halter; a rope

content.content: そんなことをすると頸に縄がかかるぞ
If you do such a thing, you will get a rope round your neck―you will be hanged.
親父の頸に縄をかける奴だ
He will involve his own father in disgrace.

なわぐ〔索具〕
〈名〉(=船の索具)Tackle; tackling

なわしろ〔苗代〕
〈名〉A rice-nursery; a hotbed

content:
なわつき〔縄付き〕
〈形〉In bonds:(名詞に用いれば) a prisoner in bonds; a criminal

content.content: 彼は縄付きで送られた
He was sent in bonds.
この家から縄付きを出すのはいやだ
I don't like to have the house disgraced with the arrest of a criminal.

なわて〔縄手〕
〈名〉A raised foot-path between rice-fields

なわとび〔縄跳び〕
〈名〉Rope-skipping:(=する) to skip (rope)

なわぬけ〔縄抜け〕
〈名〉Slipping one's bonds:(=する) to slip one's bonds; to free oneself from one's bonds

なわのれん〔縄暖簾〕
〈名〉
1. (=縄の暖簾)a rope-curtain
2. (=飯屋、居酒屋)a chop-house; a tavern

なわばしご〔縄梯子〕
〈名〉A rope-ladder:(マストのは) ratlines

content:
なわばり〔縄張り〕
〈名〉
1. (事) stretching a rope; roping off:(場所) a roped-off space:(=する) to stretch a rope; to rope off (a space)

content.content: そこは縄張りがしてある
The place is roped off.
縄張りをして見物人を入れない
The space is roped off from the spectators.

content: 2. (=勢力範囲、利益範囲)one's sphere of influence; one sphere of interest; one's domain

content.content: 人の縄張りを犯す、縄張りを荒らす
to trespass on one's sphere of influence―encroach on one's domain
博徒が縄張りを争う
Gamblers quarrel over their sphere of interest.

content: 3. (=非常線)a cordon

content.content: 縄張りをする
to post a cordon

content: 4. (=選挙区)a constituency

なわめ〔縄目〕
〈名〉Bonds

content.content: 縄目にかかる
to be bound―be put in bonds
縄目の恥を受ける
to be disgraced with bonds―put in bonds
縄目を切る
to burst one's bonds
縄目を脱ける
to slip one's bonds
彼は縄目を脱けようとしてもがいた
He struggled to free himself from his bonds.
縄目を解く
to unbind a prisoner―release a prisoner―set a prisoner at liberty

content:
なん〔男〕
〈名〉A son (used in combination with a numeral)

content.content: 長男
the eldest son
彼は次男だ
He is the second son.
三男
the third son
彼は三男二女あり
He has three sons and two daughters.

content:
なん〔難〕
〈名〉
1. (=困難)difficulty; trouble

content.content: 難に当たる
to tackle a difficulty―deal with a difficult situation―scope with the situation―grapple with the situation
一国の語を修めるのは難中の難である
Nothing can be more difficult than to master a foreign language.
難無く
without difficulty―with ease―easily
彼は難無く成功した
He succeeded with ease―walked over the course.
難無く及第した
I passed with ease―had no difficulty in passing―come off with flying colours.
難無く目的を遂げた
I accomplished my purpose with ease―I had no trouble in accomplishing my purpose.
簡より難に入る
to be progressive
生活難
difficulty of living―high cost of living
住宅難
scarcity of houses

content: 2. (=災難)a calamity; a disaster; harm

content.content: 難に逢う
to meet with a disaster―come to harm―come to grief
風波の難に逢う
to be overtaken by a storm (at sea)
難を避ける
to keep out of harm's way―take refuge―take shelter
居留民は公使館に難を避けた
The residents took refuge―sought refuge―in the legation.
亡命者は日本に難を避けた
The refugee found shelter in Japan―fled to Japan for safety.
一難去ってまた一難
“One calamity follows on the heels of another”―“Out of the frying-pan into the fire”

content: 3. (=危難)a danger

content.content: 君の身に大難が降り掛かっている
A danger impends over your head.

content: 4. (=非難)blame; charge; reproach

content.content: 彼の処置は緩慢の難を免れない
His conduct is open to the charge of laxity.
彼の行為は難の打ちどころが無い
His conduct is above reproach.

content: 5. (=非難すべき点、欠点、疵)a blemish; a defect; a fault

content.content: この本は緻密に過ぎるの難がある
The book has the fault of over-minuteness.
人の難を言えば限りが無い
Everybody has his faults―Nobody is without his faults―Nobody is free from faults.
難を言えば色が少し黒い
If I were to find fault with her, I should say that her complexion is too dark.
色の白いのは七難隠す
A white complexion covers a multitude of sins.
人の七難は見えても我十難は見えぬ
“One can see the mote in one's brother's eye, but not the beam in one's own eye”

content:
なんい〔南緯〕
〈名〉The south latitude; the south parallel

content.content: 南緯四十度二十分に在り
It is situated in lat. 40° 20′ S (=latitude forty degrees twenty minutes south).

content:
なんい〔難易〕
〈名〉Difficulty (or facility); hardness (or ease); relative difficulty; the degree of difficulty

content.content: 仕事には難易がある
All kinds of work are not equally hard―Some kinds of work are harder than others.
報酬は仕事の難易による
The recompense depends on how difficult the work is.
報酬は仕事の難易によって違う
The remuneration varies with the hardness of the work.
仕事の難易によって社会の階級を定むべきである
The relative difficulty of the work should determine the social rank of a man.

content:
なんか
〈副〉→『

content.content: など〔抔〕

content:
なんか〔何か〕
〈不定代名詞〉→『

content.content: なにか〔何か〕

なんか〔南下〕
〈名〉Southing:(=する) to south; to go south

content:
なんか〔軟化〕
〈名〉Softening; mollification; relaxation:(=する)(すべて堅いものが) to soften:(骨などなら) to mollify:(頑固な人なら) to relax; to go soft

content.content: 先生近頃軟化した
He has relaxed―gone soft―of late.
反対者は金で軟化した
The opposition was bribed into acquiescence.

なんか〔軟貨〕
〈名〉Soft money; bank-notes

content:
なんかい〔何回〕
〈疑問副詞〉→『

content.content: いくたび〔幾度〕
いくど〔幾度〕

content:
なんかい〔難解〕
〈形〉Difficult to understand; hard to make out; unintelligible (language); abstruse (doctrine); crabbed (style, etc.)

content.content: Emerson の文章は難解だ
Emerson is hard to understand―hard reading.
この本には難解の箇所がある
There are some hard passages in this book?
君の言うことは難解だ
You talk in riddles.
これは難解だ
This is a riddle―a puzzle―an enigma.

content:
なんかげつ〔何カ月〕
〈疑問詞〉How many months?:(不定詞に用いれば) so many months

content.content: 何年何カ月在学したとお書きなさい
You must write that you have been in school for so many years and months.

content:
なんかのゆめ〔南柯の夢〕
〈名〉A transient dream; the transiency of human joys

content.content: その栄華は南柯の一夢となりぬ
His splendour passed away like a dream.

content:
なんかん〔難関〕
〈名〉A barrier; an obstacle; a difficulty

content.content: 入学試験は学生の難関である
The entrance-examination is a barrier in the way of the student.
難関を切り抜ける
to overcome a difficulty―surmount an obstacle―get over a barrier―find a way out of the difficulty
この難関を切り抜ける途はこれのみである
This is the only way out of the difficulty.
この難関さえ切り抜ければ後は楽だ
Once over this barrier, we shall be in smooth water.

content:
なんぎ〔難儀〕
〈名〉Difficulty; trouble; hardship; trial; distress; misery; suffering; affliction; privation; adversity:(=な) difficult, hard, troublesome, laborious, uphill (work); arduous (task); tough (job); toilsome (journey); trying (experience); distressing (poverty); afflicting (illness):(=する) to see hardships; to go through hardships; to have a hard time of it; to be hard put to it (to provide for one's family):(病気や貧乏のためなら) to suffer (from illness or poverty):(不自由のためなら) to suffer privations; to rough it:(逆境のためなら)to struggle with adversity; to contend with difficulties

content.content: 彼は今難儀している
He is in difficulties―in distress―in great trouble―in deep water―in hot water.
貧乏をして難儀している
He is suffering from poverty―distressed by poverty.
病気で難儀している
He is suffering from an illness―afflicted with a disease.
台湾へ行って暑さで難儀した
I suffered from the heat in Formosa.
物入り続きで難儀している
A constant drain on my purse has left me in great distress.
彼は家族を養うのに難儀している
He is hard put to it to support his family.
支那内地は旅行が難儀だ
Travelling is difficult―A traveller is beset with difficulties―in the interior of China
今頃の旅行は難儀です
Travelling is a trying experience at this time of the year
一日十里は女の足には難儀だ
Ten ri a day is a tough job for a woman.
この子を育てるにはひと通りの難儀でなかった
It cost me no common trouble to bring up this child.
彼は若い時難儀している
He had many difficulties to contend with in his youth.
難儀に逢う
to see hardships―have a hard time of it―suffer privations―rough it
彼は北海道へ行って難儀して来た
He has seen hardships―had a hard time of it―in Hokkaido.
戦争へ行って難儀して来た
He has had to suffer privations―rough it―in the war.
世の中へ出て難儀するのは青年には薬だ
It does a young man good to rough it―suffer privations―see hardships―contend with difficulties―struggle with adversity―in the world.
車が無くて途中は雪で難儀した
No kuruma was to be had, and I had a hard time of it walking it through the snow.
航海中はしけで難儀した
We had a hard time of it in a storm at sea.
彼は種々の難儀をしのいで今の身上になったのだ
He has built up his fortune after going through many hardships.
人に難儀をかける
to get one into trouble
あんな人と付合うと難儀させられるぞ
Such men will get you into trouble.
あんな者と夫婦になると一生難儀するぞ
If you marry such a man, he will lead you a dog's life of it.
女房にはこれまで難儀させたからこれからは楽をさせます
So far I have led my wife a hard life of it, now I will lead her an easy life of it.
人の難儀を我が身に引き比べる
to enter into another's troubles
医者や弁護士は人の難儀で飯を食う
Doctors and lawyers live on people's troubles.
あの人には難儀した時に助けて貰った恩がある
He was a friend in need.
難儀な仕事
laborious work―uphill work―an arduous task―a tough job
難儀な路
a hard road―a toilsome journey

content:
なんぎょうくぎょう〔難行苦行〕
〈名〉Penance; asceticism; self-mortification; religious austerities:(=する) to do penance; to practise asceticism; to practise austerities:(肉欲を制するためなら) to mortify the flesh

content.content: 難行苦行の生活
an ascetic life―an austere life―a penitential life

content:
なんきょく〔南極〕
〈固名〉The South Pole:(=の) Antarctic

content.content: 南極を探検する
to explore the South Pole
南極探検
an Antarctic expedition
南極探検に行く
to go on an Antarctic expedition
南極地方
the Antarctic region
南極帯
the Antarctic zone
南極圏
the Antarctic Circle

content:
なんきょく〔難局〕
〈名〉A difficult situation; a grave situation; a delicate situation; a desperate situation

content.content: 難局に当たる、難局に処す
to deal with a difficult situation―tackle a grave situation―handle a delicate situation―cope with the situation―grapple with the situation―stand in the breach―stand in the gap
誰かよくこの難局に当たらん
Who shall cope with the situation?―bell the cat?
潔く難局に当たる
to face the situation―face the music
彼はいかなる難局にも処し得る人だ
He is equal to any occasion―He will rise to the occasion―rise superior to the occasion.
彼はよく難局に処した
He was equal to the occasion―He rose to the occasion.
政府は非常な難局に立っている
The government is in a desperate situation.
君にそうされると僕は難局に立たねばならなぬ(苦しい立場になる)
You place me in a delicate situation.
彼は立派に難局を切り抜けた
He came out of the situation―emerged from the situation―with credit.
内閣は外交を誤って難局に陥った
The Cabinet got into difficulties by a mistaken foreign policy.

content:
なんきん〔南京〕
〈固名〉Nanking:(形容詞に用いれば) China; Chinese

content.content: 南京米
China rice.
南京町
the China town―the Chinese quarter
南京豆
the peanut
南京虫
the bed-bug
南京玉
glass beads
南京繻子
Chinese satin.
南京焼
china―china-ware

content:
なんく〔難句〕
〈名〉A difficult phrase; a hard passage

content.content: 難句集
a collection of difficult passages

content:
なんくせ〔難癖〕
〈名〉A fault

content.content: 難くせつける
to find fault with one―give one an ill name―“Give a dog an ill name and hang him”
人に難くせつけて追い出すとはひどい
It is hard of him to give me an ill name and dismiss me.

なんけん〔難件〕
〈名〉A difficult matter; a delicate business

なんこう〔南航〕
〈名〉Southing:(=する) to south; to sail south

content:
なんこう〔軟膏〕
〈名〉A salve; an unguent; an ointment

content.content: 水銀軟膏
mercurial ointment

なんこうふらく〔難攻不落〕
〈形〉Impregnable, inexpugnable (fortress, etc.)

なんこつかん〔軟骨漢〕
〈名〉A weak character; an invertebrate

なんこん〔男根〕

〈名〉Suffering; distress; misery; strait:(=する) to suffer (misery); to be distressed; to be in distress; to be in straits

content.content: 難題をかける
to make terms

content:
なんどきでも〔何時でも〕
〈副〉At any time; whenever (you like); at a moment's notice

content.content: 何時でもお出でなさい

ご入用の節は何時でもご用立てます

content:
なんとなく〔何となく〕
〈副〉Somehow; for some reason or other; without knowing why; unaccountably; indefinably; vaguely

content.content: あの人は何となく気がねがある

彼は何となく人になつかない

あの人は何となく打解けないところがある

蚕をいじるのは何となく気味が悪い

なんとなれば〔何となれば〕

content:
なんとも〔何とも〕
〈不定代名詞〉
1. Nothing

content.content: 彼は何とも言わなかった
He said nothing.
何とも言わずに席を立った
He left the room without saying anything―without a word.
何ともお礼の申しようがありません
I know not in what words to thank you―I can never thank you enough.
何とも申しわけがありません
I know not how to apologize―I don't know what excuse to make!
お気の毒で何とも申し上げようがございません
I do not know how to console you.
何とも言えぬ

(文頭に置けば)―There is no saying―(文尾に置けば)―for aught one knows―(独立句に用いれば)―Who knows?―God knows―(形容詞に用いれば)―unspeakable sorrow―inexpressible feeling―indescribable beauty―unutterable grief―ineffable joy―indefinable charm―exquisite pleasure
何とも言えぬ
Who knows?―God knows.
どうなるか何とも言えぬ
There is no saying what may happen.
戦争になるかも知れぬ何とも言えぬ
A war may break out for aught we know.
彼は米探かも知れぬ何とも言えぬ
He may be a spy for aught I know.
何とも言えぬほど美しい
It is indescribably beautiful.
彼女の目には何とも言えない意味があった

あの人は何とも言えない愛嬌がある
There is an indefinable charm about him.
天国へ行ったような何とも言えない悦びを覚える

困難に打勝つのは何とも言えぬ愉快だ

彼はなんともかとも言えない大ばかだ

なんともかとも言えないいやな味だ

なんともかとも言えぬいやな匂いだ

何とも思わぬ
to think nothing of hardships―make nothing of a hard task―care nothing for dangers
彼は艱難辛苦を何とも思わない
He thinks nothing of hardships.
一日十時間の授業を何とも思わない
He makes nothing of teaching ten hours a day.
あの男は嘘をつくくらいは何とも思わない
He makes no scruple of lying―makes no bones of lying―makes nothing of telling a lie.
あの人はけがくらいは何とも思わぬ
He cares nothing for accidents.
何ともない
to feel nothing―to be all right―to be none the worse for it
痛くも何ともない
I feel no pain at all.
落第しても何ともない
I am none the worse for my failure.
こんな損は何ともない
I am none the worse for such a trifling loss.
あの人が居なくとも何ともない
I do not feel his absence at all―I do not miss him at all―I prefer his room to his company.
金が無くとも何ともない
I do not feel the want of money at all.
悪口を言われても何ともない

傷は治って何ともない
The wound has healed, and gives me no trouble.
彼が居なくても何ともない
I do not miss him at all.
加減が悪いかと問われて何ともない
I am all right.

content.content: この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet―It has a sweet smell―an agreeable smell―a pleasant smell―a fragrant smell―a sweet perfume―a sweet scent―a sweet aroma.
この薬は匂いが悪い
This medicine smells bad―It has a bad smell.
匂いの好い花
a sweet-smelling flower―a fragrant flower
匂いの悪い物
a foul-smelling thing―a stinking thing

This medicine has a strong smell.
何かの匂いがする
I smell something―There is a smell of something.
ガスの匂いがする
I smell gas―There is a smell of gas.
いやな匂いがする
I smell something bad―There is a bad smell.
これはいやな匂いがする
It has a disagreeable smell―an unpleasant smell―an offensive smell―a nasty smell―a vile smell―a villainous smell―a foul smell―It stinks.
うまそうな匂いがする
I smell something nice―There is a smell of something nice.
これはうまそうな匂いがする
It has a savoury odour.
焦げ臭い匂いがする

This coat smells of musk.

匂いを嗅ぐ
to smell anything

Smell this rose.

Some people can not bear the smell of beef.
匂いをつける
to perfume anything

This handkerchief is perfumed.

The air is redolent of flowers.
匂いを抜く
to take the smell

Show it the fire, and the smell will go off.
この香水は匂いが抜けた
The perfume has lost its smell.

content:
にぎる〔握る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=手などを握る)to grasp, clasp, grip (one's hand); to clutch (one's arm); to clench (one's fist); to take hold of (anything)

content.content: 人の手を握る
to grasp one's hand―clasp one's hand―(握手するの意味なら)―shake hands with one―shake one by the hand
自分の手を握る
to clench one's fist―double one's fist―shut one's fist
手を握り合う
to link hands with each other
強く握る
to grip one's hand―clutch one's arm
しっかり握る
to take a firm hold of anything
手に汗を握って勝負を眺めた

(自分の手を放すのなら)to let go one's hold―release one's hold―(人の手を放すのなら)―let go of one's hand―leave hold of one's hand―free one's hand―disengage one's hand
彼は握ったら放さぬ
He holds fast―He grips like a vice―He is as close as a vice.

content: 2. (=権力を握る)to hold, assume, wield (power or authority); to hold, have (the power) in one's hands

content.content: 権力を握る
to assume the power―wield the power
彼は権力を握っている
He holds the power in his hands―has the power in his hands.
政権を握る
to wield political power―assume the reins of government―take the reins of government

The Conservatives hold the reins of government―The Conservatives are in power.
彼は天下の権を握っている

天下の大権を握る
to hold the supreme power of the state―wield the sceptre―sway the sceptre
天下の枢機を握る

彼は会社の全権を握っている
He holds absolute power over the company―holds sway over the company―bears sway over the company.
学校の全権を握っている
He holds absolute power over the school―He is absolute master of the school―He is the autocrat of the school.
彼は実権を握っている
He holds real power―He has the real power in his hands.
裏面におって実権を握っている
He is the power behind the throne.
覇権を握る
to assume the hegemony―gain the ascendancy―maintain one's supremacy
東洋の覇権を握っている

英国は制海権を握っている

彼は財布(財政権)を握っている
He holds the purse-strings―He has the control of expenditure.

君は肉が付いた

content:
により〔似寄り〕
〈名〉Resemblance; likeness:(=の) like; similar

content.content: 似寄りの例がある
There is a similar instance.

content:
による〔似寄る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: にる〔似る〕

content:
にょろにょろ
〈副〉

content.content: 蛇がにょろにょろ這う
A snake crawls on its belly―wriggles along.

にら〔韮〕
〈名〉A kind of leek

content:
にらみ〔睨み〕
〈名〉A glare

content.content: にらみが利く
to command respect
子どもに嘘をつくとにらみが利かない
If you deceive a child, you can not command its respect.
下に親しむとにらみが利かなくなる
“Familiarity breeds contempt.”

content:
にらみあい〔睨み合い〕
〈名〉Glaring at each other; enmity; hostility

content.content: 二人はいつもにらみ合いだ
They always stand glaring at each other.
今のところでは資本家と労働者はにらみ合いの姿だ
As matters now stand, capitalists and labourers are at odds―at loggerheads―at daggers drawn―with each other.

content:
にらみあう〔睨み合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=互に睨む)to glare at each other

content.content: 二人はいつも睨み合っている
They always stand glaring at each other.

content: 2. (=相反目する)to be at variance ［at odds, at loggerheads, at daggers drawn］ with each other

content.content: 資本家と労働者がにらみ合っている
Capitalists and labourers are at odds with each other―Capitalists are at odds with labourers.

content: 3. (=対峙する)to watch each other

content.content: 二人はにらみ合って容易に手を出さない
They watch each other, each waiting for the other to attack.

にらみっくら〔睨みっくら〕
〈名〉A staring match

にらみつける〔睨み付ける〕
〈他動〉To glare at (one); to frown at (one); to scowl at (one); to glower at (one); to look daggers at (one)
